He is 70 years old and married. He receives a monthly amount as a pension. At times he does bricklaying work because his pension is not enough to cover his expenses and services.

He suffers from cataracts in both eyes. The right is more affected because he has totally lost that vision. He is worried that the same might happen to his left eye, and he could be left blind.

He does not have enough resources to pay for the treatment.

loans.use: to pay for opthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela lives in Lahore with her family. She is 45 years old and a mother of three sons and a daughter. She is a loving and caring person. Her husband runs a banner writing business. He has good calligraphic skills and can write in different styles. He impresses his clients and gets good orders for writing banners. Being a small business his income only covers their major household expenses leaving nothing for savings. In order to complete some orders he wants to buy paints of different colors but does not have the required funds. Consequently, Nabeela has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner. 

Nabeela is happy to support her husband and hopes his talent will pay off and their living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy paints for her husband's banner writing work.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 27 years old and a mother of three children. She is married and her husband is a fisherman. Angie works hard to support for their family.

Angie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional new fishing nets for her fishing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional new fishing nets.

loans.name: Euvenia

texts.en:
Euvenia is 49 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Euvenia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, and eggs, etc. She has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future, Euvenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, and eggs, etc

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado debido a que sus padres ya no le pudieron seguir pagando el estudio, actualmente está casada y tiene 2 hijas las cuales ya se independizaron y tienen sus propias familias y ella vive solo con su esposo.

Marta, se dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde hace 4 años y fue una amiga quien la motivo a involucrarse en este negocio; ahora ella se desplaza por toda la comunidad, ofreciendo sus productos y caminando aproximadamente 5 kilometros.

Marta, necesita el préstamo para comprar té medicinal, extracto de noni, reductores de peso y entre otros productos naturales; para tener más variedad de productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes y de esta forma obtener mejores ganancias.

Marta, sueña con tener un negocio grande, que le genere los suficientes ingresos para poder salir adelante junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Marta, aged 53, studied until fifth grade, as after this point her parents could no longer afford to pay for her education. She is now married, and has two children who are independent and have their own families. She now lives alone with her spouse.

For the last four years, Marta has earned a living selling natural medicines, after a friend encouraged her to get into this business. She now travels around the community, selling her products and walking approximately five kilometers.

Marta needs the loan to buy medicinal tea, noni extract, weight loss products and other natural products. This way she will have a larger variety of wares to offer to her clients and will gain a higher income.

Marta dreams of having a large business which will generate enough income for her to get ahead with her spouse.

loans.use: to buy medicinal tea, noni extract, weight loss products and other natural products.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Tessie is 48 years old and two of her children are in school.

Tessie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as fruits and sticks.

Tessie has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as fruits and sticks.

loans.name: Yolima Isabel

texts.es: Yolima es una mujer de 39 que deseaba emprender un proyecto para generar ingresos  para aportar a los gastos de su hogar, ella reside con su cónyuge y tiene cinco hijos menores de edad que emanan muchas necesidades, así que decidió incursionar en el negocio de los alimentos, motivada por una amiga que le sugirió colocar un puesto de fritos en las cercanías de un colegio del sector donde reside al sur de Barranquilla. Aunque no tenía experiencia la venta de fritos, estos son unos pasabocas típicos de la Costa Caribe colombiana y su preparación es muy conocida entre los habitantes de la región, de este modo emprendió con resultados positivos hasta la fecha.  Ella esta presta a recibir a su clientela a partir de las 5 a.m. hasta las 10 a.m. a transeúntes y estudiantes que meriendan con sus productos; empanada, carimañolas, arepas, deditos y buñuelos. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en la compra de víveres y alimentos al por mayor, pues se obtiene descuentos por volumen de compra y sus ingresos serán mucho mayores. Yolima planea incrementar su oferta de productos, manteniendo buena calidad y excelentes precios. Su meta familiar es comprar su vivienda.
texts.en: Yolima, 39, wanted to start a business so that she could help to support her partner and five young children.  She had a friend who operated a food stand at a school in their Barranquilla neighborhood and decided to start a similar business.  Although she had never operated a food business before, she decided to make and sell snacks that are traditional to Colombia's Caribbean coast, foods that everyone here knows how to make.  She works from 5am to 10am, selling to passers-by and students who snack on her empanadas, carimañolas, arepas, etc., and says the business has been successful.  She is applying to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan, her first, that she will use to buy the supplies she needs to carry on the business.  The investment will allow her to buy in bulk and take advantage of the relevant discounts.  For future, Yolima plans to add new items to her menu, maintain the quality of the food she sells and control her pricing.  Her goal for her family is to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a widow with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old.

Lucila has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, etc. Lucila has been in this business for 4 years. 

Lucila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory of soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Mangga 03 Group

texts.en:
The Mangga 3 group is composed of five women. Yanti, a 34-year-old woman, is appointed as the leader. She is married to Naama, a 37-year-old tailor, and is blessed with three children, namely: Wulan, 14, in the first grade of senior high school; Windy, 12, in the first grade of junior high school; and Maher, 1 year old.

To make more income, Yanti operates a kiosk business. It has been running for seven years. This business helps her to meet their living needs.

Yanti was thinking of selling more products at her kiosk, such as noodles, wheat, snacks, sugar, rice, etc., but she needs more money to do so.

When she and her group members were told about TLM group loan products, they were enthusiastic about the loan. They then formed the Mangga 3 Group and requested a loan of IDR 10,000,000 for their businesses.

Just like Yanti, the other members also want to invest their loan portions for their businesses. They are sure the loan from Kiva, via TLM, will benefit their businesses' continuity.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks such as noodles, wheat, snacks, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 54-year-old married woman and the mother of six children - four adults and two school-aged children. They live in Carles, Iloilo, where she operates a small sari-sari (general store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

Edna is asking for a loan to buy more stock of goods to sell. She hopes to purchase drinks, noodles, canned goods, spices, sugar, coffee, biscuits, snack foods, laundry soap, condiments, and other food products. She will also buy beauty products, cosmetics, and apparel from a company to re-sell in her store. With this, she will be able to improve her stock and attract more buyers to her store.

In the future, Edna dreams of being successful and having a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy drinks, noodles, canned goods, spices, sugar, coffee, biscuits, snack foods, laundry soap, condiments, and other food products; as well as beauty products, cosmetics, and apparel for her store.

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is 57 years old and widowed with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

Norlita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Norlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, noodles, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 60 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. Cristina has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Angeline works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Angeline is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Angeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman, 46 years old with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishnet, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for two years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishnet, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Welda

texts.en:
Welda is a 42-year-old widowed woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Welda has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy supplies needed like nail color, nail polish, etc.

Welda has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies needed like nail color, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a woman with one child and a very hard working entrepreneur. She is now 20 years old.

Jennifer has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 32-year-old woman who lives with her family in Ajuy, Iloilo. She is married and the mother of a three-year-old boy. Her husband is a fisherman and works hard to provide for the needs of their family. 

Eager to help her husband, Elsie successfully started her sari-sari store (general store) business. Elsie wants to expand her business so that it can be sustained. To make this happen, she needs more stock to increase her sales. That is why she is asking for a bigger loan amount. She will use the money to buy more commodities, such as soft drinks, liquor, chips, bread, biscuits, eggs, spices, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, sugar, coffee, toiletries, powdered milk, and chocolate drink.

With a stable business, Elsie wants to be able to obtain a good education for her son. With your help, we can possibly help this woman reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, liquor, chips, bread, biscuits, eggs, spices, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, sugar, coffee, toiletries, powdered milk, and chocolate drink

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
From Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Lucia finds joy in her fish reselling business, which she has operated for more than 40 years. Enjoying good profits, she is able to meet the needs of her family.

Lucia is requesting this loan to buy more stocks of fish to resell.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish to resell.

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is 48 years old, married, and lives in Unidos, Plaride, Misamis Occidental. She offers manicures, pedicures, and hair care treatment in her neighborhood. Her business supports her family.

Lalaine requested a loan, which she will use to buy nail polishes, hair care treatment, and other items needed for her business.

loans.use: to purchase nail polishes, hair care treatment, and other items needed for her business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a hardworking farmer and a dedicated father to his two adult-age children. He has raised his children well, evident in that they have finished their studies in college and have landed good jobs.

He is also an active member of Paglaum MPC and had availed himself of loan programs for farmers like him. Recently, he accessed a loan of PHP 6,500 to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 23-year-old woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jessica has a aluminum and glass supply business in the Philippines and requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy aluminum and glass.

Jessica has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy aluminum and glass for her business.

loans.name: Melany

texts.en:
Melany, a 22-year-old mother of one, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past year she has had an electronic load business in the Philippines.

Melany has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy electronic load wallets for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy electronic load wallets for her business.

loans.name: Marta Inés

texts.es: Marta de 49 años es una emprendedora mujer que ejerce distintos roles en su vida y manifiesta que gracias a ellos se mantiene en constante dinamismo y salud. Ella es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad y en compañía de su cónyuge reside en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla en donde funciona su negocio de venta de materiales de reciclaje; cartón, papel y plásticos. Su cónyuge fue el creador del negocio hace 12 años y fue quien la motivó para que trabajaran en la misma actividad en la que ha obtenido excelentes resultados y su familia se ha visto favorecida.  Semanalmente realiza las ventas de los materiales de reciclaje a comerciantes y mayoristas, cuyos pagos se realizan inmediatamente recibidos los materiales. Marta desea invertir en un mayor volumen de materiales y poder incrementar sus ventas, así como proporcionalmente sus utilidades, para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar cartón, metales, plásticos y papel.  Su meta familiar a largo plazo es remodelar su vivienda y fidelizar a su clientela con buen servicio y excelentes precios.
texts.en: Marta, 49, is an enterprising woman who keeps her different roles separate from one another and says that doing so is the best way to keep healthy and active.  She lives with her partner in one of Barranquilla's southern neighborhoods and has two grown children.  She operates a business buying and selling waste materials--cardboard, paper, plastic, etc.--for recycling.  Her partner started a business buying and selling recyclable materials 12 years ago and she decided to jump on board.  She sells the recyclable materials to commercial buyers once a week and collects for the sales on the spot.  Marta says the business is a success and wants to expand.  She is applying to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan, her first, that she will use to buy cardboard, metals and other waste materials that she will resell.  Marta goals for the future are to improve her business and remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy waste materials for her recycling business.

loans.name: Yessica Yamileth

texts.es:
Yessica, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer muy hogareña, estudió solo educación básica, está acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y la albañilería y viven junto a sus hijos los cuales aún se encuentran estudiando.

Yessica, desde pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar, es por eso que es bastante esforzada en las tareas que corresponden al hogar; desde tempranas horas se levanta a hacer limpieza y prepararles los alimentos a su esposo y sus hijos.- Sin embargo, cuando tiene espacio libre, deja a su bebé con su hermana para que lo cuide, mientras ella se dirige al cerro para ayudarle a su esposo en las labores agrícolas.

Yessica, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizante para maíz, pues tienen sembrados 21,000 metros cuadrados de milpa y necesitan incorporarle nutrientes antes que se dé la floración, para que la mazorca crezca de forma más vigorosa y la planta sea más resistente a las inclemencias del clima.

Yessica, sueña con darle una buena educación a sus hijos, para que éstos se preparen y lleguen a ser profesionales que contribuyan a la sociedad y formen sus propios hogares.
texts.en:
Yessica, aged 39, is a home-loving woman. She has only had primary education, and is now in a relationship. Her spouse works in agriculture and building, and they live together with their children who are in school.

Since a young age, Yessica's parents taught her to work hard, which is why she puts great effort into the chores at home. She gets up early to do the cleaning and to prepare food for her spouse and children. However, when there is the opportunity, she leaves her baby to be looked after by her sister, and goes to the hill to help her husband with farming work.

Yessica needs this loan to buy fertilizer for corn, as they have sown 21,000 square meters of corn which they need to give nutrients before they begin to flower so that the ears of corn grow strong and the plants are more resistant to the harshness of the climate.

Yessica dreams of giving her children a good education, so that they are prepared to become professional adults who contribute to society and make their own homes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for corn.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 38-year-old active borrower of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. Her husband has been running an auto spare parts shop for the past five years.

Farzana's husband wants to expand the size of his business so that he can fulfill the demands of his daily customers and provide better reselling services of auto spare parts. However, due to financial problems, her husband is not in such position to bear these expenses.

Therefore, Farzana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to afford all relevant expenses in the expansion of his business and buy the above relevant items to fulfill his customers' needs.

For this financial assistance, Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's spare parts business.

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica is 47 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She has been selling clothes and practicing farming activity for the last thirteen years.

She earns a monthly income of twenty-five thousand Kenya shillings. This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of clothing for sale.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and family.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Pedro Joaquin

texts.es: Pedro es un técnico electricista reconocido en un sector de Soledad  que ofrece mantenimiento y reparación de televisores, abanicos, licuadoras, lavadoras y todo tipo de electro menor, en esta actividad tiene 34 años de experiencia y es ampliamente referenciado por sus clientes, quienes consideran que ofrece un excelente servicio. Pedro tiene una familia numerosa, él es padre de siete hijos, de los cuales dos son aún menores de edad y depende económicamente de él, su cónyuge lo apoya en sus decisiones y reconoce su talento. Pedro requiere un stock de componentes, repuestos y cableado, para ofrecer un servicio mucho más completo y ágil, por ello está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en esta necesidad. Su meta a futuro es mejorar la imagen del negocio y su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Pedro operates a well-known electrical repair business in Soledad.  He repairs and services televisions, fans, blenders, washing machines and other household electricals.  He has operated the business for 34 years and his customers enthusiastically recommend him to others.  Pedro has a large family: seven children, only two of whom still live at home.  His partner knows his talent and supports his decisions.  Pedro is applying to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan, his first, that he will use to buy spare parts and other supplies for carrying on his business.  The investment will allow him to deliver a faster and more complete service to his customers.  His goals for the future are to improve his business and build a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buys supplies for his electrical repair business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 58 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like bread, cupcakes, junk food, home care products, and other groceries to sell in her store.

Gloria has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like bread, cupcakes, junk food, home care products, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 44-year-old married woman with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosario has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Rosario has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Hillside High School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Alex. He is the Director of Hillside High School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Bunamwaya in Kampala with 350 students. Hillside High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining an Ultra filtration water treatment system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase an ultra filtration water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Hillside High School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Alex ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Alma Maribel

texts.es:
Alma, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera y tiene un niño de 1 año de edad y viven en casa de su madre.

Alma, aprendió a trabajar en la tierra desde que era muy joven, porque sus padres eran muy pobres y tenian que colaborar con los gastos y oficios del hogar, el lugar donde tiene sus cultivos está 2 kilómetros aproximadamente de su vivienda y las labores las realiza por la mañana. 

Alma, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes foliares y pesticidas para control de maleza; de esa forma obtendrá mejor rendimiento en sus cosechas y mejorará sus condiciones económicas.

Alma, sueña con ver a su hijo convertido en un profesional y también sueña con tener su casa propia y darle las mejores condiciones de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Alma, is 24 years old and studied until secondary school. She is a single mother with a one year old child, they live in her mothers home.

Alma learned to work in the fields from an early age because her parents were very poor. They all had to help with household expenses and house work. Alma's fields are located in a place approximately two kilometers from her home and so she works during the morning.

Alma needs a loan to buy plant fertilizers and pesticides to control weeds. This will allow her to increase the yield of her crops and improve her income.

Alma dreams that she will see her son become a professional.She also aspires to having a home of her own and to be able to provide a better life for her son.

loans.use: to buy plant fertilizer and pesticides to control weeds.

loans.name: Noureen

texts.en:
Noureen is 42 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is the mother of 3 children and her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family. Noureen has also been involved in a business selling clothes for the past 10 years, and contributes her income to help manage the household.

Noureen needs to buy different types of clothes for the purpose of reselling, but is not in a position to do so due to insufficient financial means. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

Noureen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: she wanted to increase her cloth business

loans.name: Mohammadu

texts.en:
Mohammadu is a maize farmer from Baure village. As a member of Babban Gona, Mohammadu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of Maize per hectare of land -- 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mohammadu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, however, Mohammadu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Mohammadu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Rorn, a farmer and also village chief of Prosat village, lives with 2 children. Spending day and time raising 2 children alone, she wants to have a comfortable life. Currently she is still keeping on farming and helps her children business.

Rorn has difficulty in using a battery for home energy. She needs to recharge the battery every week. Seeing the difficulty of using car battery, she decided to apply for Kiva to buy solar home energy. She believes solar home energy can enhance her living lifestyle in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Prosat Village, Da Commune, Kampong Leng District

loans.name: Bảy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Bảy is 29 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling clothes for 8 years. Bảy lives in Yen Dinh district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And there are many shops selling beautiful clothes with competitive prices, so the income is unpredictable.

The main hardship that Bảy faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to expand her business and increase the income by purchasing more clothes to resell. In 2013, Bảy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Bảy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

In the future, Bảy hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to expand her business and increase the income by purchasing more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a drum of kerosene.

loans.name: Claudia Antonia

texts.es: Claudia de 35 años de edad es una madre soltera que lucha por dar bienestar a su única hija, una niña de seis años, ella es una comerciante de prendas de vestir y accesorios, actividad que inició con el apoyo de una cuñada que le consiguió clientes en la empresa para la que trabaja y adicionalmente le prestó el capital inicial.  Claudia entregó todo lo mejor de sí en esta actividad y logró el éxito en su negocio, hoy en día cuenta con cuatro años en esta actividad muy comprometida y motivada, todos los días de la semana ella está disponible para sus clientes a quienes visita en su lugar de residencia y empresas para promocionarle su oferta de productos,  es por ello que es muy importante mantener renovada las colecciones de ropa y accesorios, pues esto le permite dinamizar sus ventas y en la temporada decembrina que es una época en la que por las fechas especiales se reúnen familiares y amigos, es muy importante contar con un buen atuendo, es por ello que solicitó un crédito, su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar blusas, vestidos, accesorios y abastecer la demanda de sus clientes.  Su meta a futuro es mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is 35 years old.  She is a single mother who fights for her only daughter’s well-being.  Her daughter is a six-year-old girl.  

She is a saleswoman of outfits and accessories.   She started this line of work with the support of her sister-in-law, who found customers in the company where she works and who also loaned her starting capital.  Claudia gave her all to this line of work and found success in her business.  These days she has four years of experience.  She is very committed and motivated.  

She is available to her customers every day of the week.  She visits them in their homes or business in order to promote her line of products.  Because of this, it is very important to keep her collections of clothing and accessories up-to-date, because this encourages sales.  In the December season, a time of year when families and friends get together, it is very important to have a good dress.  Because of this, she is asking for a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy tops, dresses, and accessories to meet the demands of her customers.  Her future goal is to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy tops, dresses, and accessories to meet the needs of her customers

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en: Rosalita is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC, and she has been helped by various programs of the cooperative, including the insurance program. She is grateful for the cooperative's services that enable pensioners like her to still access financial assistance despite their ages. Recently, Rosalie has requested a loan so that she can buy the maintenance medicines she needs.

loans.use: to buy the maintenance medicines she needs

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a single woman with no children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetic shop, her customers being town-dwellers and neighbors, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. In addition, she operates a business selling clothes and utensils that gives her another source of income.  

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions

loans.name: Darwin Jacinto

texts.es: Darwin tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre su pareja se dedica a realizar los quehaceres domésticos del hogar y cuidar  a sus tres hijos Heidy de 7 años, Stephania de 5 años estudian en escuelas del sector. Neymar de un año permanece junto a  su madre.Darwin hace 10 años atrás se dedica a cuidar, alimentar,  chanchas reproductoras vendiendo las  crías generando una fuente de ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas del hogar, el necesita el dinero para construir una chanchera que protegerá del excesivo  frio de la noche,  a los nuevos cerdos evitando que enfermen y mueran obteniendo mayores  ganancias para alimentar, educar a sus hijos a futuro desea ampliar el negocio.
texts.en: 24-year-old Darwin lives with his partner. She does the housework and looks after their three children, Heidy (7) and Stephania (5), who go to local schools, and 1-year-old Neymar, who stays with his mother. 10 years ago, Darwin began keeping and feeding pigs and then selling their offspring to generate income to cover basic household needs. He needs the money to build a pigsty to protect the new pigs against the cold so they do not become ill and die. This will enable him to boost his income and use it to feed and educate his children. His ambition is to extend his business.

loans.use: to build a pigsty.

loans.name: Danjuma

texts.en:
Danjuma is maize farmer from Chirai village. As a member of Babban Gona, Danjuma is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Danjuma would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Danjuma can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Danjuma is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Herbert Adrian

texts.es:
Herbert, de 27 años de edad, está acompañado, estudio hasta noveno grado en la escuela de su cantón, su pareja vende tamales en el mercado de la ciudad y su hijo aún no estudia porque está pequeño.

Herbert, trabaja en una funeraria desde hace 4 años y de ese trabajo que genera los ingresos necesarios para alimentar a su pequeña familia.

Herbert, necesita el préstamo para comprar un vehículo, para que su esposa pueda trasladarse fácilmente hasta el lugar donde vende los tamales, porque actualmente tiene que pagarle a alguien para que la traslade en carro particular y si tuviera carro propio se ahorrarían ese gasto.

Herbert, sueña con hacer más grande el negocio de los tamales y obtener más ingresos y así vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Herbert is 27 years old and in a common law marriage. He went to school until the ninth grade in his town. His partner sells tamales in the city market. His son is not yet in school because he's too young. Herbert has worked in a funeral parlor for 4 years. From that job he generates the necessary income to feed his small family.

Herbert needs the loan to buy a vehicle so that his wife can travel easily to the place where she sells tamales. Currently they have to pay someone to take her by private car, and if they had their own car, they would save that expense. Herbert dreams of making their tamale business bigger, and bringing in more income to live better.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle so his wife can easily travel to the place where she sells tamales.

loans.name: Blanca Justina

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de 42 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, constante y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max paredes’ caracterizada por acoger a la mayor parte de la producción manufacturera y al comercio informal.
Blanca es de tez morena, baja estatura y físico robusto. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida, ella se especializa en la venta de sopa de pollo ya que es una comida fácil de preparar y que tiene mucha demanda en el lugar, “cocino sopa de pollo porque los clientes les gusta y vienen a diario…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los clientes tienen la costumbre de tomar sopa, la desventaja son los muebles viejos y deteriorados que ahuyentan a los clientes. Su sueño es  abrir una sucursal de venta de comida, ella desea comprar sillas y mesas para atender a más clientes y de mejor manera. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Blanca solicita un préstamo para comprar mesas y sillas para vender sopa de pollo.
texts.en:
Blanca is 42 years old, married, and has a 3 year old son. Her business is food sales. She is a good mother, consistent and very responsible. Her business is in the "Max Paredes" zone, known for attracting the majority of the manufacturing production and the informal business sector. Blanca has brown skin, and is short and stocky. Her maternal language is Aymará, but she also speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband who works in construction, and her son who is not yet old enough for school. They live in a rented house made of brick, that has running water, electricity and plumbing.

Her business is the sale of food. She specializes in the sale of chicken soup, as it is a dish that is easy to prepare and is in high demand in that area. "I cook chicken soup because the customers like it and come daily," she says. The advantage of her business is that the customers are in the habit of eating soup. The disadvantage is that the furniture is old and deteriorating, which drives away the customers. Her dream is to open another food sales location. She wants to buy chairs and tables to better attend to her customers. This is the first round of loans with the institution in the 15 years she has been in her business. For these reasons Blanca seeks a loan to buy tables and chairs to sell chicken soup.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to sell chicken soup.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is 63 years old, is married and lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City. He is a hardworking farmer and will do everything for his family. He now needs a loan to pay for the tuition fee of his daughter and asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC. Felix wants to see his child finish her studies and have a stable career.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee of his daughter

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Doña Felipa es una clienta con 47 años de edad, casada y con tres hijas. Vive con su esposo, una hija y tres nietas. Humilde y muy trabajadora. Tiene bastante trayectoria en la Fundación y se ha caracterizado por su excelente comportamiento de pago. Inició su actividad productiva con la venta de joyería de Oro, luego invirtió también en perfumes finos y cortinas. Ha tenido altibajos en su negocio después de que una hija falleció, debido a ésto ella sufrió de depresiones pero con la ayuda de sicólogos ha podido poco a poco superarlo. Cuenta con dos fotocopiadoras heredadas por su hija fallecida y brinda los servicios de fotocopiado y venta de artículos escolares en su comunidad, debido a que vive cerca de la escuela.  Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y docentes. Cuenta con el apoyo de una hija, la cual vive con ella para dar el servicio de fotocopiado y levantado de textos. Cuando la clienta tiene que salir a vender o cobrar, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, la cual la transporta en su carro en sus tiempos libres. Doña Felipa necesita invertir en Oro y en materia prima para generar ingresos y ayudar a sus hijas y nietas en los estudios universitarios y escolares. Su objetivo es crecer a nivel personal como de negocio, asi mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia..
texts.en:
Felipa is a humble and hard-working 47-year-old client who is married and has three children. She lives with her husband, a daughter and three grandchildren. She has an excellent track-record with Fundacion in handling her repayments.

Her career began with selling gold jewelry, but she later also invested in fine fragrances and curtains. She has had ups and downs in her business following the death of one of her daughters. She suffered from bouts of depression, but with the help of psychologists she was able to slowly overcome this.

She has two photocopiers that she inherited from her deceased daughter and she provides photocopying services and sells school supplies in her community since she lives near the school. Her customers are neighbors, family members and teachers. She relies on the help of the daughter she lives with to provide photocopying and document digitizing services. When Felipa needs to go out to sell or to collect money owed her, she relies on the help of her husband who drives her in his car in his free time.

Felipa needs to invest in gold and in supplies to generate income and help her daughters and granddaughters with their school and university studies. Her goal is to grow both personally and with her businesses thereby improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy gold and supplies.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 34 years old and married with two children.

Charito works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Charito has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is 44 years old and has one child in school. She is single.

Dalia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Dalia has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ana Aracely

texts.es:
Ana, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja es empleado y sus hijos están pequeños y aún están estudiando en la escuela y viven con ella.

Ana, tiene tienda desde hace más de cinco años, en donde vende productos de la canasta básica.

Ana, solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, entre otros para surtir más la tienda y así poder brindarles a sus clientes variedad en sus artículos de venta.

Ana, sueña con darle el estudio a sus hijos hasta graduarse y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old and studied up to Grade 9. She is in a relationship, her partner is an employee. Her children are young, they are still studying in school and live with her.

Ana has had a store where she sells basic food items for more than five years.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy more products like rice, beans, sugar and coffee amongst others to stock her store more. Doing this she can provide her clients variety in the items for sale.

Ana dreams of providing education for her children until they graduate and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy more products like rice, beans, sugar and coffee amongst others to stock her store more.

loans.name: Jhony Esteban

texts.es: Jhony tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres, el se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado pequeño, comenta que este es un buen negocio  ya que por medio de esta actividad él puede sustentar los gastos de su familia, Jhony va a invertir el crédito en la compra de mas crías y aspira poder ampliar su negocio para seguir adelante con sus gastos diarios de su humilde hogar.
texts.en:
Jhony is 23, single, and lives with his parents. He makes his living raising and selling young livestock. He says this is a good business as it allows him to pay his family's expenses.

Jhony will use his loan to buy more calves and hopes to expand his business to continue to cover the daily expenses of his humble home.

loans.use: to buy and sell calves.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is a maize farmer from Rika village. As a Babban Gona member, Micah is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and to superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Micah would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan, Micah will be able to store the maize he harvests and sell it later in the season, when he can obtain a price up to 37% higher than the market price for it.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Micah no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Micah hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to purchase a motorbike and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Artesanas De Chontala Group

texts.en:
In the area of Chontala, a small community high up in the mountains of Central Guatemala outside of the city of Chichicastenango, live these ten ladies, who form the trust bank “Artesanas de Chontala,” or “Artisans of Chontala.” Chichicastenango is an indigenous K’iche city, famous for its huge market and adherence to its deep-rooted cultural traditions. Some of the Artesanas de Chontala were able to study through primary school. All of the women are very happy working with Friendship Bridge learning useful information about business management, which gives them the tools they need to invest their credit wisely and see the resulting growth that comes in their businesses and families.

Ruth is a 22-year-old member of the group who manages a tailoring business, embroidering fajas and huipiles, traditional belts and blouses, which she sells in the Chichicastenango market. She studied through second grade, and now takes care of her two-year-old little boy in addition to running her business, with goals to send him to school. With dreams to expand her business, Ruth is requesting a new loan that she will invest in buying high-quality threads and more fabric for the blouses she makes.

Ruth’s skills in embroidery help her business, allowing her to sell a more unique variety of products, with designs that stand out in the Chichicastenango market, where many artisans sell their wares. With two loan cycles in Friendship Bridge, she is very happy and full of hope for her future as a merchant and artisan.

Thanks for supporting ladies like Ruth.

loans.use: to buy high-quality threads and more fabric for the blouses she makes.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en: Leonor is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC. She is 54 years old, married, and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She hopes to live comfortably with her family, and so she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC to buy hollow blocks, bags of cement, and iron rods to complete the building of her house.

loans.use: to buy hollow blocks, bags of cement, and iron rods to complete the building of her house.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 35-year-old married man from Dier El Balah city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family standard of living help them live more comfortably.
 
Rami took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Rami will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.
 
Rami appears in the photo.

loans.use: in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is a farmer from Alegria, Lopez Jaena. She is married with adult age children. She is a hardworking farmer who pushes her abilities just to earn more. 

Eulalia wishes to renovate their house, and for this reason she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC. The amount will be used to buy wood, sticks, plywood, nails for house repair.

loans.use: to buy wood, sticks, plywood, and nails for house repair.

loans.name: Dorita

texts.en: Dorita is a vegetable grower in Talairon, Oroquieta City. She is a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC and has accessed its loan program for farmers like her. Recently, she has requested a loan to pay for land preparations such as plowing, harrowing, and trellising. Dorita hopes to have a successful harvest so that she can save up to renovate the bunk house where she stores her rice produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparations such as plowing, harrowing, and trellising.

loans.name: Hợi's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hợi is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has been working in agriculture raising chickens for 2 years. Hợi lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Hợi faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby chickens to raise and sell in future. In 2014, Hợi joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hợi has successfully repaid a loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader a three-member group.

In the future, Hợi hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby chickens to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Dionesa

texts.en: Dionesa is 78 years old, married, and lives in Oroquieta City. She is a businesswoman, primarily selling rice and corn for human consumption. Now that she's old, she has handed down the management of her business to her children. Because she needs to pay for a medical check-up and purchase maintenance medicines, she has asked for a loan from Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up and purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn is known in Tangub City for her lumber sales business. She is 35 years old and married with school-age children.

An active member of Paglaum MPC, Adelyn has requested this loan to purchase more wood and lumber to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more wood and lumber to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma pushes her abilities when it comes to her hog-raising business. She finds satisfaction in this endeavour not only because she is making good sales but also because she enjoys operating this type of enterprise.

Vilma is primarily supported by Paglaum MPC, and in turn she nurtures her membership in it. She recently requested a loan of PHP 30,000.00 to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Michell

texts.en:
Michell is a 24-year-old married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Michell has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shirts and underwear to sell to her customers.

Michell has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shirts and underwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with six children. She is 33 years old and three of the children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nelia has a buy-and-sell vegetable fertilizer business in the Philippines and requested a loan of 6000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetable fertilizer to sell.

Nelia has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetable fertilizer to sell in her business.

loans.name: María Elba

texts.es:
María, de 64 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada, su pareja es agricultor.

María, vende tortillas desde hace más de cinco años y de esa manera le ayuda a su pareja para cubrir los gastos de la casa.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz para elaborar las tortillas.

Ella, sueña con hacer más grande el negocio de tortillas y así percibir mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 64 years old and did not go to school. She lives with her partner who is a farmer.

Maria has been selling tortillas for more than five years and through this work is able to help her partner cover their household expenses. Maria needs this loan to buy corn to make tortillas.

Her dream is to expand her tortilla business and bring in more income.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is the age of 30 and lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She has a son to take care of.  She is a tailor by profession.  She is engaged in a cloth sewing center to earn an income. She started her cloth sewing center 10 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses. She has as her source of work the creation of all types of articles of clothing. She enjoys teaching others this skill that can help them make a living. Now she wants to increase her business.Fouzia is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kiva’s partners BRAC Pakistan. The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine, which she needs to be able to fulfill the requests of her customers.
Fouzia will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for herself

loans.name: Mujeres De Pasaccap Group

texts.en:
The trust bank Mujeres de Pasaccap is located in Totonicapan in the Western Highlands. Ebelina is a member of the group. She is 22 years old with one small child, whom she and her husband raise. In spite of her young age, Ebelina is an amazing businesswoman and with much effort, has developed a thriving textile business. She has three industrial sewing machines and makes everyday skirts, rather than the traditional typical ones called “cortes.” Ebelina is requesting a new loan, as she has a dream of purchasing an additional industrial sewing machine to increase production! This young woman has a very bright future ahead of her!

Ebelina and the ladies in the trust bank really look forward to the educational trainings during their monthly meetings. After they transact business on their loans, a facilitator from Friendship Bridge shares useful information with them on a variety of subjects including business, nutrition and health, and self-esteem. These educational trainings result in improved hygiene and health care as well as decreased malnutrition. And, of course, the ladies can maintain and expand their small businesses as they learn about budgeting, accounting, customer service, and marketing.

In funding loans for Ebelina and the women in the trust bank, Kiva investors are offering these women a better future for themselves, their families, and their community in Totonicapan. Thank you for your generosity!

loans.use: to purchase an additional industrial sewing machine to increase production.

loans.name: Quyên

texts.en:
Mrs Quyên is 32 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling snacks for four years. She lives in Bim Son, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover market need is low in this region, and the income from her business is not high enough to do what she really needs for comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Quyên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true. In the future, Quyên hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora, is a hard-working woman who earns a living by operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, eggs, cooking oil, sugar and spices.

She is a fifty-one year old married woman with four children. Her oldest is 22 and the youngest is 14. Her husband's occupation is a carpenter.

She has requested a loan to purchase supplies for her store like rice, feed, and groceries. In that way, she can improve the content of her store and continue to serve her customers well. Slowly, her income will improve, thus, she can afford to buy healthy food and provide better shelter to live in.

In the future, Flora would like to expand her sari-sari (variety) store business in order to improve the living condition of her family.

Flora is grateful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like rice, feed, and groceries for her store.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en: Marcial is 70 years old and married, and he lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. He is an active member of Paglaum MPC and has made use of various products and services of the cooperative, including insurance. Recently, he has requested a loan so that he can purchase hollow blocks and bags of cement to renovate his dirty kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase hollow blocks and  bags of cement to renovate his kitchen

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en: Edelyn is on her way to renovating her house. She is a businesswoman from Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She has requested a loan from Paglaum MPC to finance her house renovations. The loan will be used to buy construction materials, such as bags of cement, hollow blocks, and other items.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en: Porferia is 67 years old, married and lives in San Vicente, Tangub City. She is an active member of the cooperative and is doing well in her chosen business ventures, buying and selling various commodities. Recently, she has asked for a loan to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines.

location.town: Tangub- San Vicente, Tangub City, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 31 years old and has five children. Evelyn is married and four of her children are in school.

Evelyn is in the agriculture business raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Evelyn has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Eulinda

texts.en:
Eulinda is 32 years old and has three children. Eulinda is married and two of her children are in school.

Eulinda is in the agriculture business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Eulinda has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eulinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: La Purisima

texts.en:
La Purisima is 46 years old and single with six children, three of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family.

La Purisma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, canned goods, etc. She has been in this business for 3 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
This nice and very elegant lady’s name is Ani and she lives with her parents in Kpan city of Syunik region. Ani graduated Yerevan State Linguistic University, the faculty of English Language and Literature. She is only 24 years old but is already employed and works at her specialty. She is a teacher of English Language and Literature. She also has a group of pupils to whom she gives paid private course in her subject since they must get prepared for the entrance exams. Ani mentions that she likes her pedagogical activates and works very seriously and with great responsibility.

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams she is going to be used for the purchase of bookshelves, a computer and also professional literature in order to make her working room more comfortable and the quality of her courses better and more informative.

loans.use: for purchase of bookshelves, computer and  professional literature to make her work room more comfortable and the quality of her courses more informative.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 33 years old woman, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with one son and two daughters, who are in school. Her husband has been running her own business of clothes selling for 10 years.

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase them. Therefore Sajida is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Hamza has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hamza would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Hamza can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Hamza will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Hamza is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Zubairu

texts.en:
Zubairu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Zubairu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Zubairu would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zubairu will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when her can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Zubairu now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: 10 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 7 meses y 3 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es buena madre, sensible y muy encantadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘el torno’ área rural, distante a 62 kilómetros de la ciudad.
Claudia es morena de baja estatura y cabello negro (de pie al centro, viste polera negra), su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Las ganas de mejorar su negocio la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; agricultura, venta de refrescos, venta de huevo, elaboración de sombreros de sao, artesanía en cuero, comercio de animales de granja y venta de semillas. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos como lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, pintura de ojos, maquillaje, y otros, “las señoras son muy coquetas y siempre les gustan las novedades…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede cuidar a sus hijos y darse tiempo para vender, la desventaja es la falta de cosméticos para ofertar y mejorar las ventas. Su sueño es abrir una tienda en su casa para poder cuidar a sus hijos, ella desea comprar cosméticos de temporada para ofertar a sus clientes antiguos y conocer nuevos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Claudia solicita un préstamo para comprar cosméticos para vender en su tiempo libre y cuidar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia is a young 19 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has two children, one three years and the other seven months old. Her business is selling cosmetics.

Ella is a good mother, sensible and very charming. She does her business in ‘El Torno’ a rural area, 62 kilometers from the city.

Claudia is dark-skinned, short with black hair (She is standing in the center, wearing a black shirt). She shares her life with her partner who works as a driver and her children who are not yet school age. They live in a house that belongs to the family built of wood that has electricity and well water. The desire to improve her business led her to form a communal bank with people with businesses like: agriculture. the sale of soft drinks, selling eggs, making straw hats, leather handicrafts, selling farm animals and the sale of seeds.

Her business is the sale of cosmetics like lipstick, nail polish, eyeliner, make-up and others. "Women are very concerned with their appearance and they always like innovation", she commented. The advantage of her business is that she can care for her children and have time to sell. Her disadvantage is the lack of cosmetics to offer to improve her sales. Her dream is to open a store in her house so she can care for her children. She wants to buy seasonal cosmetics to offer to her old customers and meet new ones. This is her first loan with the institution in the two years she has been in this business.

It is for these reasons that Claudia is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics to sell in her free time while taking care of her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell in her free time while taking care of her children.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay is 61 years old. She is a rice farmer with two children. One of her child is a garment worker and another one attends school. Her husband is 55 years old, he is a rice farmer as well. They live in Takeo Province of Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $11 per day.

Now she would like to apply for a loan of $1,500 to buy cows to feed to resell. This loan will help her earn more incomes. In the future, Lay is going to buy more farmland, build a bigger house and support her youngest child to earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy cows to feed to resell

loans.name: Thảo's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thảo, 41 years old and married, has been working in agriculture raising cattle for more than 10 years. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, and hers is a low-income household in the village.

Thảo's business has a very long capital turnover, and if cattle disease strikes, her income will be uncertain. The main hardship that she faces is lack of capital.

Thảo, the leader of a three-member group, is requesting a loan to purchase more healthy cows for reproducing and the equipment necessary to upgrade her business productivity. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, and she hopes it will improve her living standard.

In the future, Thảo hopes for her children to find good jobs, her family to be healthy and happy, and her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more healthy cows for reproducing and necessary equipment to upgrade her business productivity.

loans.name: Ghinwa

texts.en: Ghinwa is a 20 year old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and four siblings. Her father works in the agriculture field for many years in order to fulfill their daily needs and represents the main income source. Ghinwa is focusing only on her study and doesn’t work. Today, with the aim to pay her Technical registration fees, she is applying for a loan from kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans to continue her education.

loans.use: to pay her Technical registration fees

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 50 year’s old married woman living with her husband and two children, still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family in order to satisfy the family needs. And as for her, to supplement the family income, she works from home in selling homemade food to all neighborhood. Today, in order to pay her children’s technical fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. Her only target is to see them pursuing their education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her children’s technical fees

loans.name: Finding Nemo Group

texts.en:
Mrs Yến is 26 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling fish for five years. Yến lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her household was recognized by local government as poor. Moreover the market need is low in this region, and the income from this business is unstable because the price and the amount of fish depend on weather conditions.

The main hardship that Yến faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to increase her business by purchasing more fish to resell.

In 2014, Yến joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Since then, her income has improved significantly, so she would like to get a loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to upgrade her standard of living. She is the group leader of Finding Nemo," which consists of three members.

In the future, Yến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to increase her business by purchasing more fish to resell.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie was able to manage her vegetable garden to meet the needs of her family. Until now, the farm was still doing well and she was earning enough cash to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With her generated revenue, she was able to save for their future needs and to repay her previous loan.

Jessie requested another loan, which she will use to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer to improve her farm. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, she expects an increase in the harvest so as to expand her farm and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seedlings and fertilizer for her vegetables.

location.town: P1, BITIBOT, SAPANG DALAGA, MISAMIS OCCIDENTAL

loans.name: Herginia

texts.en: Herginia operates a convenience store in her home, which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC. She wants to expand her business and requested a loan, which he will use to purchase raw ingredients such as kilos of meat, spices. and bags of rice for her "carenderia" (eatery) business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as kilos of meat, spices, and bags of rice for her "carenderia" (eatery) business.

location.town: Tangub - Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a single man. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and his primary customers are locals. Kenneth describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He now wants to start a dairy farming business and has taken a loan of Kes 50,000 loan to buy a dairy cow .This will enable him earn more income from the sell of milk. His business goal is to own a taxi within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is making a good profit from her farming in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Through her farming, she is able to provide for her family. Recently, she has requested a loan for her business from Paglaum MPC. The loan will be used to pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing, and seeding and to purchase high-quality corn seed.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing, and seeding and to purchase high-quality corn seed.

loans.name: Claudia Germania

texts.es: Claudia tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus dos hijos, Anthony de 10 años y Jhared de 1 año, ella tiene un puesto de comidas rápidas en su localidad, se dedica a este negocio hace dos años,  gracias a esta actividad ella puede sacar adelante a sus dos niños, Claudia solicita de este crédito para incrementar  su negocio y de igual manera sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Claudia is 22 years old, single and lives with her two sons, Anthony who is 10 and Jhared who is 1. 

She has a fast food stall in her town. She has worked on this business for two years. Thanks to this business she can provide for her two children.  

Claudia requests this loan to expand her business and, similarly, her financial income.

loans.use: to expand her fast food stall.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en: Raheela is 31 and a mother of three children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She has a small child in her care. Her husband is a power loom worker by profession, which he has been doing for four years to meet the family’s expenses. A loom is a device used to weave cloth and tapestry. The basic purpose of any loom is to hold the warp threads under tension to facilitate the interweaving of the weft threads. Raheela’s husband wants to buy a power loom to increase output, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to buy a power loom. Therefore Raheela has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Raheela's husband can buy a power loom to increase output and income. Raheela and her family will be thankful to KIVA lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy a power loom for her husband

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
