Nino is 53 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Khobi district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow and 3 calves. Nino milks the cow every day and produces dairy products for family use. In addition the family owns a small plot of land, where they grow maize.

Nino wants to start a trading business, as the farm income is only seasonal. She requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes to resell. This will give her a chance to generate stable income. Nino hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothes.

loans.name: Asifa

texts.en:
Asifa is a 37 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. Her husband is the guardian of the family and manages the entire household. Her husband has been running his own business as a toffee and sweets wholesaler for the past 18 years.

Asifa's husband needs to buy toffee and sweets in bags in bulk and other commodities for reselling purposes, but due to financial constraints her husband is unable to purchase these commodities. Therefore Asifa has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her husband in buying these commodities for reselling purposes to earn the maximum profitable income. This income will also help him to make savings to meet the needs of the family and business.

Asifa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy toffee and sweets for her husband's wholesale business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first pre-pay microgrid

loans.name: Mangtup

texts.en:
Mangtup is maize farmer from Rika village. As a member of Babban Gona, Mangtup is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mangtup would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mangtup can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Mangtup is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.en:
Maria is a 28 year old woman, married to a loving husband for 4 years. She thinks of herself as a very active woman, according to people interviewed by Kubo. She is very good at business.
Maria has no children and lives with her husband in a house of their own, Maria's case is a very special one, because she is the main economic support of the household. She has two vans which are used for public transport. The vans are driven by her brother and her husband and her brother pays her a fee for the usage of the van.

Maria doesn't like to stay at home and do nothing and she enjoys working, so she decided to sell lingerie in order to manage an extra income for her home.

Maria's vans haven't been able to move and her brother and husband have been struggling to work, so in order to keep the vans moving and her brother and husband employed, Maria is looking for a 13,000.00 MXN, with which she would be able to repair the vans as soon as possible and keep managing the usual income.

loans.use: to fix her van

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Grace, 57 years old and blessed with 11 children.
She practices maize and beans farming and also runs a retail shop. She is taking a loan from Kiva to purchase additional stock of rice, sugar and flour that will help in improving profits thus be in a position to support her family.
She is grateful to Kiva and hand in hand Eastern Africa for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of rice, sugar and flour that will help in improving profits .

loans.name: Cristo Abre Las Puertas 1, 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is the coordinator of her group, Cristo Abre Las Puertas (Christ open the Doors) 1, 2 & 4. This group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry, where these businesspeople run their activities in their community and others nearby.

Ramona is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes for men, women and kids. With this loan she will increase her inventory. The other members run different businesses like a cafeteria and underwear, bakery and clothing sales. Ramona will use her profits to improve her home and invest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is a 60 years old single mother who had five children; three of them are married while the two are still attending to school. She is a beautician and manicurist for many years.With her determination to have a stable source of her family income, she is asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP5,000. This loan will be use to buy a blower, chemicals for hair rebonding.

loans.use: to buy blower and chemicals for hair rebonding for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 62 years old. She is a widow and blessed with three children. Her business is farming and livestock trade. She has been in the business for 20 years. 

She earns a monthly income of twenty five thousand Kenya shillings. This is her seventh loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy more livestock for sale. 


She will use the profits from expanded business to increase her savings and meet the family budge. Her hopes and dreams are to be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy more livestock for sale.

loans.name: Davida

texts.en:
Davida owns a "carenderia" or an eatery. She serves home-cooked meals to local settlers situated inside the public market in her town. She is a 52-year old married woman and has eight children, four of whom are still attending school. Her husband earns a living by selling meat.

It has been for quite many years now that Davida has run an eatery. She would like to boost her livelihood. She needs additional capital that will enable her to serve her customers' needs well. In that way, she can increase her sales and slowly handle her finances.

Davida decided to take out a loan to meet her financial need. She has requested a loan to buy supplies like meat, vegetables, spices and soft drinks. These are very essential in her day-to-day livelihood activity. In this way, she can continue to support the needs of her family.

She dreams that she will be able to continue to send all her children to school in preparation of their bright future.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat, vegetables, spices and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en: Rael is 54 years old. She is widowed and blessed with 5 children. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for 5 years. This is her 2nd loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy stock of charcoal for sale and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family. She will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to buy a plot of land to build her house and fully educate her children to uplift their lives.

loans.use: to buy stock of charcoal for sale and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 37 years old. He is married and blessed with 2 children. He runs a retail shop and has been in the business for 4 years. This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to purchase stock of sugar, milk, tea leaves, detergent, rice, cooking oil and maize flour for sell and make more income to support his family. He will use the profits from expanded business to provide for the needs of his family and also buy seeds and fertilizer for farming. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, milk, tea leaves, detergent, rice, cooking oil and maize flour for sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself as visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have the best business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and cereals. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and cereals. She hopes that in the future she will have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and cereals.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is able to earn for about PHP 7,000 every month. Because of the business, she’s able to help her husband earn income and pay for bills and other expenses  The loan that she previously applied for and was approved by Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was used to buy merchandise items for her business. She wants to thank CCT and lenders for their financial provision.

She’s experiencing difficulty in collecting payments which she considers a challenge in the business. Despite that, she’s determined to earn more each day to save money and invest for their own house someday.

She decided to apply for a loan amount of P20,000 that will be used for buying personal products like ready-to-wear clothes, lotion, cosmetics and perfumes to add to her "buy and sell" (retail) business. Also, the spare amount will be used as a revolving fund. She’s determined to succeed on the business for her family and hoping that CCT would once again consider her loan application.

Milagros believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: To buy personal products like ready-to-wear clothes, lotion, cosmetics and perfumes to add for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Saul Adalberto

texts.es: Saul tiene 74 años de edad, el es de estado civil soltero, vive solo, a pesar de su avanzada edad él se dedica a la producción de leche, de igual manera trabaja al jornal, el solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca para incrementar su negocio al que se dedica más de 30 años.
texts.en: Saul is 74 years old.  He is single and lives alone.  In spite of his advanced age he works as a dairy farmer.  He also works as a day laborer.  He is asking for this loan to buy a cow to expand his business, which he has been working at for more than 30 years.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rubén Dario

texts.es:
Rubén, de 30 años de edad, es agricultor, está casado, tiene dos hijos y estudio hasta noveno grado.

Rubén, es comerciante de ganado desde hace 4 años y tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la agricultura; ambas actividades las aprendió de sus padres, pero además de eso también comercializa cerdos.

Rubén, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaquilla y comprar abono para el cultivo de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz que tiene sembrados.

Rubén, sueña con tener ganado lechero, porque actualmente solo tiene ganado de repasto y quiere incrementar sus ingresos y poder darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rubén is 30 years old.  He is a farmer.  He is married and has two children.  He attended school through the ninth grade.

Rubén has been a cattle merchant for four years, and he has fifteen years of experience working in agriculture.  He learned both lines of work from his parents.  Besides this, he also sells pigs.

Rubén needs this loan to buy a heifer and also to buy manure for the crop he has planted of 7,000 square meters of corn.

Rubén dreams of having a dairy herd because currently he only has grazing cattle and he wants to increase his income to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a heifer, as well as manure for the crop he has sown, composed of 7,000 square meters of corn

loans.name: Heni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Heni, who is a 38-year-old married woman with two daughters. Heni has a small shop and her husband has been an employee for five years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Heni will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Tazeem

texts.en:
Tazeem is responsible mother of 3 children, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 17 years. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Tazeem has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Tazeem's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Tazeem also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Tazeem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en: Latifa is a 26-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband and mother of three children, all of them are still attending school. Her husband works as an employee in a company and in parallel owns a cattle farm to be always ready to ensure his family a good life. Today, Latifa looks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational installment fees. This is her fifth loan from Kiva and definitely, she eager to take additional loans in the future that will help her to ensure them a good education path.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational installment fees

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a beautician and manicurist for many years.She is married and had seven children. With her willingness to increase her income,she is seeking for financial assistance amounting to PHP3,000 allowing her to buy chemicals for hair rebonding and variety nail polish.She is hoping for continuous growth of her business to sustain her family daily necessities.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for hair rebonding and variety nail polish for her business

loans.name: Einar

texts.es: Don Einar es un señor muy esforzado, que solicita un préstamo de quinientos dólares ($500), dinero necesario para adquirir  los materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo su proyecto de ampliación de vivienda. Así podrá disfrutar junto a su familia de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Einar is a very driven man, who seeks a loan of $500, money he needs to acquire construction materials to carry out his project of expanding his home.  In this way he will be able to enjoy a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to expand his home.

loans.name: Tresia

texts.en:
Tresia is 47 years old. She is single and blessed with two children. Her business is a retail shop and farming. She has been in the shop business for two years. She earns a monthly income of four thousand Kenya shillings and ten thousand in the farm business.


This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of sodas, bread, matches, sugar, rice, soap etc. for sale. She will use the profits from expanded business to increase business stock. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy stock of sodas, bread, matches, sugar, rice, soap etc. for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 35 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for nine years. She earns a monthly income of twenty five thousand Kenya shillings. 


This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to be a successful farmer and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Living in farming community, Eng and husband devote themselves on generation family business in order to substance family living. Eng has positive view for her future business. She wants to expand business start from small business to bigger and bigger business. Beside farming, Eng owns a feeding farm; therefore, she needs to get up early to feed her cattle. She needs a lot of power to light her feeding farm at night time to prevent from chief; however, it is a challenge for her because her house doesn’t have enough energy to generate light. A car battery some times loses power without alerting.

As a result, she decided to apply for Kiva to buy a solar home system. She believes she will have enough energy for her family usage and also improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Prosat Village, Da Commune, Kampong Leng District

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Sani has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Sani can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Sani will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Sani is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Eloisa Janeth

texts.es: Eloísa tiene 37 años de edad es de estado civil casada, su esposo es albañil, tienen una hija, Juliana  de 8 años, Eloísa  se dedica hace 4 años a la venta de cosméticos, esto le permite obtener escasas ganancias, solicita el crédito para incrementar el número de productos, así podría vender más y aumentaría sus ganancias para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Eloísa is 37 years old and in a common law marriage. Her husband is a mason. They have an 8 year old daughter named Juliana.

Eloísa has worked for 4 years in the sale of cosmetics. This allows her to obtain a little income. She seeks a loan to increase the number of products, in order to sell more and increase her earnings, to be able to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to increase her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 24 years old from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He lives in his wife's house, with her family members. In spite of his high education, Giorgi can't find any stable job to make his own source of income and get financial independence. He decided to start his own business and seek for the credit among local financial institutions.

Giorgi's credit request was finally approved within the start up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that gives chance poor and inexperienced people to start or re-start their own businesses. Giorgi has found the place to hire for his new business initiative and requested financial support to rent the place and purchase stock of fruits and vegetables and start trading business. Giorgi will rent the place near the local general store that has already it's own loyal costumers, who will also purchase fruits and vegetables at Giorgi's store.

With support of the Start Up program Giorgi will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle with the financial difficulties. He awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to have a money for working capital and trade with fruits and vegetables .

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Sokheng is 19 years old, a single freshman who is from the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in law at a university in the city. His parents are the rice farmers. Sokheng has decided to take out a loan because he is short of the money to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year. This loan will help him in earning a bachelor’s degree. After graduation, he dreams of having a proper job with a reasonable salary and he also wants to save money to re-build his parents’ house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year.  He is studying law.  His parents are rice farmers.

loans.name: I'a

texts.en: I'a is a 43 year old mother with 4 children, she owns and operates a small business of selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living.  I'a requested for a loan to buy a sack of taro, banana, a fry pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, to help her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2004.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, banana, a fry pan, plastic bags, vegetable oil, for her business

loans.name: Dolores Porfirio

texts.es: Dolores a sus 47 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos una niña de 13 años y un varón de 9 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a la pesca y a prestar sus servicios de jornalero, lo que le permite sostener a su familia. Dolores desea construir un corredor en su vivienda e instalar ventanas en su vivienda para brindar mayor seguridad a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ventanas, lámina, madera, clavos y alambre para construir el corredor e instalar ventanas en su vivienda lo antes posible, con el crédito anterior el logro mejorar las paredes y cambiar el techo por lo que se siente feliz de mejorar su vivienda poco a poco con este apoyo.
texts.en:
Dolores is 47 years old and lives with his two children in the house he owns. He has a thirteen-year-old girl and a nine-year-old boy. He is a hardworking fisherman, and also offers his services as a laborer, which allows him to provide for his family.

Dolores wants to build a veranda in his home and install windows so that his family can live more safely. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in windows, planks, wood, nails, and wire, which he will use to carry out the project as soon as possible.

His previous loan allowed him to improve the walls of his house and replace the roof. He is very happy to be able to use Kiva's support to improve his housing little by little.

loans.use: to build a veranda and install windows in his home.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is 32 years old and is running a hog raising business in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He has been doing well in this business that enables him to continuously provides the needs of his family. He is also an active member of PAglaum MPC where he get his financial and non-financial assistance. Recently, he took a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en: Restituta is married with 7 adult age children who pushes her abilities in farming. She access financial services as well as technical assistance of Paglaum MPC for her farming activities. Recently, she avails a loan to pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling, seed bed preparation and purchase of bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling, seed bed preparation and purchase of bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two piglets

loans.name: Roditha

texts.en: Roditha is 44 years old, single and a known hog raiser in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She access the financial services of Paglaum MPC for her capitalization. She managed her business as well as her membership well evident that she doesn't have default payments. Recently, she avails a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Anna Lyn

texts.en:
Anna is 36 years old; a single mother of her child. In order to provide the needs of her child, she raises a small number of pigs. She earn a lot from this activity. In fact, she were able to repaid her loan and now she decided to borrowed a new loan to buy feeds for her pigs. Together with husband, they are helping each other  in raising a few piglets until they reach their marketable age. She sell it to the market and deliver it also in her loyal customers.

Anna's plan for the future is to save more money to improve the quality of life they have.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs

location.town: P1, SOUTHWESTERN POB. CALAMBA, MISAMIS OCCIDENTAL

loans.name: Louelly

texts.en:
Louelly is a 35-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been selling goods for many years, earning more profit from it. She helps her husband in providing for the needs of her family. She wants to expand her business. Recently, she took a new loan to buy more goods to sell such as canned goods, coffee, sugar, and other useful items to have more inventory stock and to have higher sales.

Louelly's plan for the future is to save more money and to improve the living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 54 years old, married and has four children.  

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 60 years old, married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer and has been into buy and sell of carabao. Josefina's youngest child is currently studying. She wants to send her youngest child into higher level of education that's why she and her husband has been doing their best to provide all their needs.

To keep her business growth, she is asking for a loan of PHP15,000 to be use in purchasing hog feed for her pigs and grocery items for variety store. She is hoping to obtain the said amount of loan for continuous smooth flow of her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed for her pigs and grocery items for her variety store business

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia tiene 43 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hija Maritza y su nieta Britani de cinco años de edad ella asiste a la escuela gratuita del sector, todos los días desde muy temprano llega a su pequeño puesto de trabajo en el mercado de la ciudad vende frutas, legumbres,  verduras por más de 26 años esta ha sido su única fuente de ingresos para alimentar, pagar el lugar donde viven. Eugenia requiere el dinero para incrementar su negocio, obtendría mayores ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 43 years old and a single mother. She lives with her daughter Maritza and her granddaughter Britani, who is five years old and is attending the local public school.

Every day, Eugenia gets up early to go to work. She runs a small stall at the town market, where she sells fruits and vegetables. This has been her only source of income for over 26 years. It has allowed her to feed and house her family.

Eugenia needs this money to expand her business and make more income in order to cover her household's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more produce.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is a 34-year-old woman from Carles, Iloilo. Like the other people in the community, Jessica and her husband are engaged in fishing business to earn a living.  They proficiently do this business for 10 years to support their children. They have four children to raise; ages 14, 12, 8 and 7 years old. Jessica wishes to augment their livelihood to have enough money to send all her children to school. To make it happen, this woman is requesting a bigger amount of loans to buy additional fishing nets to help them enhance their catch.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Wukashatu

texts.en:
Wukashatu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Wukashatu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Wukashatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Wukashatu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Wukashatu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Wukashatu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a 61 years old woman and mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son is fruit seller by profession and h sells fruits like apples, bananas, grapes etc. Her son is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage house hold.

Nazeeran's son needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that her son can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her son is not in condition to purchase fruits
.
Therefore Nazeeran has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her son to purchase the above items for business purpose.
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's fruit business.

loans.name: Mujahida Parveen

texts.en:
Mujahida is 55 years old and married, the mother of ten children.She lives in Multan, Pakistan along with her family. Her son is the sole earner and responsible for financially supporting his family.

The income generated by him is not sufficient for the family to cover all household expenses, so he wants to increase his business of poultry. He sells chicken meat at his shop. He has been doing it for the last eight years and has become famous for providing good-quality poultry products in his locality.

With the support of the BRAC Pakistan, he has gradually improved his business. Currently he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan to increase his poultry business.
This will help him to increase his sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for him. Mujahida thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy chicken for her son's shop

loans.name: Luafale

texts.en: Luafale is a 45 year old mother with 4 children, she owns and operates a small business of selling pancake, pork cake, buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. Luafale requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, to assist her run the business. She will expand her business using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan,

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
This young and nice lady is only 28 years old and she lives with her husband, daughter and parents-in-law in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Her name is Elina and she graduated State Polytechnic Institute the faculty of IT. She is very clever and elegant person and she has been working 3 years at the city’s college as a lecturer of IT and modern technologies. She is working with great pleasure and interest and makes her lectures very attractive for her students as well.

Now she needs this Kiva loan very much since having such kind of specialty, she has no computer. The one Elina used to have is broken down and it is impossible to repair. She is so hopeful that this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams she will receive and buy a computer, some accessories for it and also a new professional literature for these all. She thanks beforehand and she is sure her first deal will be the start for a further partnership as well.

loans.use: to buy a computer, some accessories for it and also a new professional literature for these

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Mustapha is maize farmer from Sarki Madarzai village. As a member of Babban Gona, Mustapha is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mustapha would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mustapha can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Mustapha is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is 43 years old and widower with five children. He works very hard to provide for them.

He runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through GDMPC to buy additional stocks of canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Pedro has been in this business for 2 years.

He successfully paid back her previous loan, and now he has requested an additional loan to further build his business.

In the future Pedro would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to his business

loans.name: Nodirjon

texts.ru: Нодирчону 40 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. У него одна 18летняя дочка, и две 17 и 8 летные сыновья. Дочка учится в университете. Сыновья учиться в средней школе. Жена Нодирчона работает уборщицей. Сам Нодиржон тоже имеет постоянную работу. Он занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Нодирчон чисто и культурно работает. Он честный и ответственный мужчина. Нодирчон хочет, чтобы его дети учились и стали образованными и  большими человеками. У его дочери первый год учебы. Нодирчон собирается оплатить на годовой обучения дочери, но у него не хватает денег для оплаты. Из-за нехватки денежных средств Нодирчон обратился за кредитом. Он надеется на Вашу поддержку и заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Nodirjon is 40 years old. He is married and has three children. He has one 18-year-old daughter, and two sons who are 17 and 8. His daughter is studying in university. His sons are schoolchildren. Nodirjon's wife works as a cleaner. Nodirjon also has a permanent job. He is a home repairs expert. Nodirjon does clean and civilised work. He is an honest and responsible man. 

Nodirjon wants his children to study and become educated and important people. His daughter is in her first year of undergraduate studies. Nodirjon intends to pay for his daughter's yearly education, but he does not have enough money. Nodirjon has applied for a loan because of his lack of funds. He is relying on your support and expresses his thanks in advance.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Bunhern's Group

texts.en:
Bunhern’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Bunhern makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bunnara's Group

texts.en:
Bunnara’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Bunnara makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sameun's Group

texts.en:
Sameun’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sameun makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer and driver to support his family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia tiene 37 años de edad, curso hasta un nivel básico, la señora sabe leer y escribir, desde muy joven tuvo que dedicarse a la agricultura, vive en una comunidad rural alejada del área urbano de la provincia de Mizque, tiene tres hijos y los tres son dependientes de la señora Lidia, el esposo de la señora trabaja junto a ellos ya que el negocio es familiar y no tienen muchos recursos para contratar jornaleros. Trabajan en terrenos en compañía ya que sus terrenos son pequeñas parcelas por esta razón trabajan en compañía con los comunarios de su comunidad.
Cultivan una gran variedad de productos agrícolas pero los mayores productos que cultivan en parcelas las grandes son la cebolla, zanahoria y papa.
La señora Lidia es una persona  muy querida y respetada en la comunidad donde vive, por lo dedicada a sus hijos y su trabajo que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar de jornalera en la agricultura para ganar algunos pesos adicionales, ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar huano de oveja para que sus cultivos tengan un buen rendimiento en la temporada de cosecha y mejoren sus ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus tres hijos y puedan asistir al colegio  en mejores condiciones. Este préstamo ayudara mucho a sus hijos y a ella en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Lidia is 37 years old. She only did a basic level of schooling, but knows how to read and write. From a very young age she had to work in farming. She lives in a rural community far from the urban area of the province of Mizque. She has three children, all of whom are dependent on her. Her husband works with them, since it is a family business, and they don't have many resources to hire day laborers. They work in the fields together, as their fields are small parcels. For that reason they work with others from their community. They grow a large variety of agricultural products, but the primary products they grow in the large parcels are onion, carrot and potato.

Lidia is a well loved and respected person in the community in which she lives. This is due to her dedication to her children and her work, as she at times even has to work as a day laborer in agriculture to make a few additional pesos. She is seeking a loan to buy sheep manure so that her crops have a good yield in the harvest season and her earnings increase, to provide a better quality of life to her three children and allow them to attend school in better conditions. This loan will help her and her children greatly in the hard work she does.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve the production of her crops, in order to generate greater income for her family.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo is a farmer who cultivates his own land with his wife. His goal is to provide a more financially secure life for his four children and his family. Rodrigo needs to pay for school fees and also cover his household expenses. Rodrigo is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer such as manure to improve his banana production. He is striving for a better life through farming and is grateful for this opportunity. Rodrigo hopes to have a better life with his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure for his banana plantation

location.town: P1, PUNTA SULONG, BALIANGAO, MISAMIS OCCIDENTAL

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vilma is 44 years old and has four children who are in school.

Vilma has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo leaves, etc..

Vilma has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo leaves, etc.

loans.name: Isnaida

texts.en:
Isnaida is 27 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Isnaida has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Isnaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en: Sophea’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khanah's Group

texts.en: Khanah’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Khanah makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Seyha

texts.en:
Seyha is 20 years old, a single freshman who resides in the Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. She is pursuing a BA degree, majoring in Finance and Banking at a university in the province. Her father is a car driver and her mother earns income from selling soup, porridge and noodles.

Due to the fact that she is short of the finances needed to pay her tuition fees from first to fourth year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to earn an associate’s degree successfully. For her dreams, she wants to find a proper job with a reasonable salary so she will be able to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from first to fourth year. She taking a degree in Finance and Banking. Her father is a driver and her mother has a food stall.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly, 20, was an outstanding student when he was in high school. He is from Takeo Province of Cambodia. Currently, he is studying at the university in the city to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in information technology.

His family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue, which makes it hard to pay his tuition fees. To pay his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, he is applying for a loan of USD 3,000.

When he finishes his bachelor's degree, Sokly wants to have a good job with a decent salary. He also wants to build a new house for his family and if he gets children he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor's or master's degrees if he can support it.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year.

loans.name: Khasan

texts.ru: Хасан  из района Джоми. Ему 42 года. Он семейный человек. Детям 22 и 10 лет. Хасан жизнелюбивый и трудолюбивый муж. Он любитель автомашин.  Хасан более 10 лет идет по стопам отца. Он перевозить товар жителей района на рынке. У Хасана есть постоянные клиенты. Свободные время он занимается таксистом перевозом людей. Хасан, данный момент не работает, по причине, что его автомашина находится на мастерской. Хасан хочет отремонтировать машину и начать работу. Его доходы только от деятельности такси. С такими планами Хасан просит Вас дать ему кредит.
texts.en:
Khasan is from Jomi area. He is 42 years old. He is a family-oriented person. His children are 22 and 10 years old. Khasan is full of joie-de-vivre, and a hardworking husband. He loves cars. Khasan has been following in his father's footsteps for over 10 years. He transports goods of the area's citizens to the market. Khasan has regular clients. In his free time he works as a taxi driver, driving people around. 

Khasan currently is not working, because his car is being repaired. Khasan wants to repair his car and start working. His income is only from his transport business. With this plan, Khasan is requesting a loan from you.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Aipopo

texts.en: Aipopo is a Samoan citizen, she is 35 years old and single. She runs a business of selling fish in her community to earn a living. Aipopo requested for a loan to buy fishing net, torch, container, ice bag, new canoe, to help her with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, torch, container, ice bag, new canoe,

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
A loan amount of WST 1,500 will help Telesia to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubers (seedlings), a backpack sprayer, chemicals and a wheelbarrow to assist her in her business.

Telesia is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a business selling taro and bananas in her community to earn a living. She will use her profit to expand her business.

She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubers (seedlings), a backpack sprayer, chemicals and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 44 years old married woman.She has been earning well in selling her vegetables in the market. For more than six years it covers their daily expenditures which she considered as their main source of income. Vicenta successfully repaid her previous loan for she is earning well from these activities.

Recently, she took a new loan for the purpose of buying new seedlings and organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest. She wants to improve her vegetable farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy variety of seedlings and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy is a 23 years old married man. He owns and operates a farm, raising crops to earn a living. For many years in farming, he has been provide the needs of the family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying fertilizer. Recently, he took out a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. Improving their farm is his plan because it is their main source of income and he wants to ensure a better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Samnag's Group

texts.en: Samnag’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Samnag makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and accountant to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a weaving bamboo  business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang, 28 years old, is a garment worker who lives in Phnum Sruoch District, Kampong Speu Province. She is a hard-working mother of three children who are enrolling in the primary school. Her husband is a farmer. This couple can make a net profit approximately USD 7.5 a day.

Samnang is faced with a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to buy a new tractor for her husband but she cannot afford to. Therefore, now she would like to take a Kiva loan.

She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a new tractor

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita works hard for her family. She endures everything to be able to provide for the needs of her family,

She requested loan assistance from Paglaum MPC to finance her fish vending business. She is taking her fourth loan of PHP 7,000.00 to buy more fish to resell.

Anecita hopes to sustain her business so that she can continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

location.town: Tangub - Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is known in Garang, Tangub City for her vegetable farming business. She is making good profits with her farming activities. Her farming activity is supported by her loan from Paglaum MPC that is also helping her with financial and technical literacy in running her business ventures.

In need of additional capital to purchase good quality vegetable seeds and bags of fertilizers, she is asking for a loan from the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase good quality vegetable seeds and bags of fertilizers.

location.town: Tangub - Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony owns KMT Automotive, located in an industrial area of San Diego. KMT Automotive is an auto sales business, specializing in the sale of low-cost vehicles.

Anthony helps low-income working families, students and teenagers make their first vehicle purchase. He purchases vehicles through the local auctions and then repairs them on a case-by-case basis. He then supplies them with safe tires and ensures the cars pass a smog test before selling the vehicles.

Anthony will use his Kiva loan for marketing materials, new signage and for the purchase of equipment, such as a computer, copier, and additional office supplies.

Within the next three years, Anthony plans to move the business to a more prominent location for increased visibility, so he can have more space to keep additional inventory.

loans.use: to pay for marketing efforts, new signage and office equipment.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 59 years old, married with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Carmen has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. Carmen requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more banana to sell.

Carmen has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more banana to sell.

loans.name: Zuurabubu

texts.ru: Зуурабубу, 49 лет, замужем, 4 сыновей. У нее среднее образование, она 15 лет в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается торговлей товарами широкого потребления (еда, напитки, сладости), стартовав с 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Зуурабубу, на данный момент в обороте есть товар на сумму 5000,000 сом (KGS). Дополнительно Зуурабубу с семьей занимаются животноводством, у них есть 5 коров, 15 овец и 2 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего торгового бизнеса, Зуурабубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 105,000 сом (KGS) на пополнение ассортимента товаров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и доходов семьи.
texts.en:
Zuurabubu is 49 years old, married, and has four sons. She has secondary education. She has been retailing common consumer goods (food, drinks, sweets) for 15 years as her main source of family income, having started with 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zuurabubu's persistent hard work, she currently has goods work 5,000,000 som (KGS) in circulation. Additionally, Zuurabubu works in animal husbandry with her family, and they have 5 cows, 15 sheep, and 2 horses. 

With the view of further developing her retail business, Zuurabubu has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 105,000 som (KGS) in order to increase her assortment of goods. She plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further expansion of her business and family income.

loans.use: to buy goods in order to increase assortment in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a drum of kerosene

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary operates a grocery store that sells assorted goods. She works hard every day in order to provide income for her family and improve their living situation.

Mary is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. This will allow her to increase her sales.

Mary's goal is to develop her business and increase her profits so she can repair her house and ensure a higher quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

location.town: PUROK ADELFA, SINIAN, BALIANGAO, MISAMIS OCCIDENTA

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma has been running her piggery business for many years.She raises a small number of pigs to provide their daily needs. She raised pigs and sells it to the market. She aims to have a greater income so she decided to avail a loan to buy feeds for the pigs so that she can produce a good quality of meats and can deliver meats to supply her customers demand and this will result a greater income. 
Elma’s plans for life the profitable production that she raises and improve the quality of their lives.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 48 years old and married with two children. With one of her children in school, Mercidita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercidita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Mercidita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Mercidita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Seinath's Group

texts.en: Seinath’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Seinath makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and motor driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Sokong's Group

texts.en: Sokong ’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokong  makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factry laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Saveoun's Group

texts.en:
Saveoun’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Saveoun makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokhum's Group

texts.en: Sokhum’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokhum works as factory laborer and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en: Norn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Norn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Gulipa

texts.ru: Гулипа, 35 лет, замужем, 5 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, в качестве источника дохода для семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая на 0,26 Га собственной земли арбузы, кукурузу, дыни. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 16 овец и лошадь. Бизнес на сегодня приносит до 17,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулипа обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят для разведения. Доходы от кредита Гулипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Gulipa is 35 years old, married, and has five children. She has secondary-specialist education, and she breeds cattle and cultivates crops as a source of income for her family, cultivating watermelons, corn and melons on 0.26 hectares of her own land. There are four cows, 16 sheep, and a horse on her farm. Today her business brings in up to 17,000 som (KGS) a month. 

With the aim of further developing her business, Gulipa has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy two calves for breeding. Gulipa plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business, in order to save money for renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase two calves in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en:
Karoline is 58 years old and married with 4 children. She is a Samoan citizen. Karoline owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing in her community. She has been running her business for 9 years, and sells her items.
Karoline is applying for a loan to help her pay for her son’s tuition fees. Karoline has had 9 loans with SPBD and has an excellent repayment record. She hopes to keep her son in university until his graduation.
His son is studying History at university and hopes to become a professional after graduating.

loans.use: pay for her son’s university tuition fees in History

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Being a farmer on the rice field, Srey is is a 50-year-old married woman with five children, two of them married. Her husband is also a farmer. This couple can only make $10 USD per day to support their family. Srey resides in a rural area of Khsach Kandal District, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in this career for nearly six years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards.

She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one piglet

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a married woman and has three grown children. She earns a living by raising native chickens. She raises and sells poultry. This is the main source of income for the family and provides food for consumption too.

She has been raising poultry for five years now. She needs to improve the quality of the poultry she is about to raise. She also needs funds to repair the roof of her animal shelter.

She had her own home for 30 years, and so she is happy to have her own welcoming place in which to live. She is asking for a loan from CEVI to invest in animal feed and galvanized iron for the roof repair. With this loan, she would have an adequate supply of feed that would sustain her business.

With her previous loan, Concepcion managed to invest in poultry to sell, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to invest in animal feed and galvanized iron to repair the roof of her animal shelter.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a 54-year-old married woman. She has three children to provide for.

In order to support her children in their daily needs, she runs a store selling snacks in town. She has been running the business for 25 years.

She wants to offer the best food and customer service that she could offer to her customers. She took a loan to purchase more snacks to sell to provide for the needs of her customers.

Nelia's plan for the future is to save money for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy more snacks to sell.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is 48 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Flaviana has a food vending business in the Philippines. Flaviana requested a PHP 8,500 loan amount through GDMPC in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Flaviana has been in this business for five years. In the future, Flaviana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredrients for her food vending business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, home product care, and other groceries.

Gloria has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a widowed woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estrella is 59 years old now.

Estrella has a food vending business in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as, rice, sugar, etc..

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Estrella has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Estrella would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Saliya

texts.ru: Салия, 53 года, замужем, 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 30 овец, 3 коровы, 2 лошади. На 1,32 Га собственной земли выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 21,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Салия обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Салия планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Saliya is 53 years old, married, and has two children. She has secondary education, and works in animal husbandry and agriculture. Thanks to her persistent hard work, her farm today has 30 sheep, three cows, and two horses. On 1.32 hectares of her own land, she cultivates barley. Her monthly income is 21,000 som (KGS). 

With the view of further developing her farm, Saliya has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to buy cows. Saliya plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business, and in home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase some cows in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Jose Lorenzo

texts.es:
José, de 73 años de edad, es agricultor, está casado, tiene tres hijos, pero solo dos de ellos viven con él y sus dos nietos.

José, siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a la ganadería, porque así lo hizo toda su familia; actualmente tiene 14,000 metros cuadrados de tierra cultivadas de maíz y está ordeñando una vaca y uno de sus nietos le ayudan a cuidar la vaca.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono y herbicidas para el cultivo de maíz; esto asegurará una mayor producción y mayor ganancia.

José, sueña con tener 5 vacas lecheras para dejarles una fuente de ingresos a sus nietos y para incrementar sus ganancias
texts.en:
José is 73 years old. He is a farmer, and is married with three children, only two of whom live with him along with two grandchildren. José has always worked in agriculture and cattle, because that's what his whole family did. Currently he has 14,000 square meters of land planted with corn, and is milking one cow. One of his grandchildren helps him care for the cow.

José needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer and herbicides for his corn crop. This will ensure better production and better earnings. José dreams of having 5 dairy cows to provide a source of income to his grandchildren and to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides for his corn crop.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 50 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. Her business is a rental houses and livestock rearing. She has been in the business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of forty two thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy and install a water tank to supply the houses with water as well as her family’s and animals’ use.

She will use the profits from expanded business to improve her standard of living. Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable family.

loans.use: to buy and install a water tank to supply the houses with water as well as her family’s and animals’ use.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 40 years old and married with five children. With five children in school, Rosalia works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosalia has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 53 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

Erlinda has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase cloth, threads, needles and other materials for sewing.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, threads, needles and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza is 41 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, milk, rice, soap, shampoo, etc.

Tereza has been in this business for 10 years.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, milk, rice, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 43 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, Dolores works very hard to provide for them.

Dolores runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Dolores has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chantha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Saratu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Saratu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Saratu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Saratu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to buy improved farm machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zubairu

texts.en:
Zubairu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Zubairu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Zubairu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Zubairu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Zubairu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Zubairu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chantha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Soeb

texts.en:
As a farmer from Santuk District, Kampong Thom Province, Soeb, 52 years old, is working very hard on the watermelon farm near her house. She is a hard-working mother of five children, four married. She can earn approximately 2.5 USD a day. Being a farmer is the main work that she has done for more than 10 years.
In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, Soeb is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy watermelon seeds, insecticides, and other related materials to grow them.
So she hopes that this requirement will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy watermelon seeds, insecticides, and other related materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is an active member of Paglaum MPC who enjoyed the perks of membership. She is 71 years old and a pensioner. She managed her membership with the cooperative evident that she doesn't have default payments. Recently, she avails a loan to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: G.s Los San Chez Group

texts.es:
El señor Saul Tiene 30 años vive en El Paraíso, al oriente de Honduras, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, Su actividad principal es la agricultura, el cuenta con tierras en las cuales siembra maíz, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace muchos años, ademas se dedica al cultivo de plantas de café y estas las vende a los productores de la zona para que estos las cultiven.
El señor Saul con el crédito que nos esta solicitando el tiene como proyecto la siembra de una manzana de frijoles y así obtener mas ingresos en su hogar. Es una persona muy trabajadora solicita el crédito en forma grupal con las siguientes personas.

Don Nolvin Alexis, se dedica a la agricultura
Don Ever David, se dedica a la agricultura
Don Jaime se dedica a la agricultura
Don Alexander se dedica a la agricultura
Don Delmer Jose  se dedican a la agricultura.

Trojes, Honduras, Septiembre 2015.
texts.en:
Saul is 30 years old and lives in El Paraíso, in eastern Honduras. He lives with his spouse and their three children. His primary job is farming. He has land on which he grows corn. He's worked at this for many years. He also grows coffee plants and sells them to producers in the area to grow.

With the loan he is seeking, Saul has plans to sow a manzana [1.72 acres] of beans, in order to obtain more income for his home. He is a very hard worker, and seeks the loan as a group with the following people: Nolan Alexis who works in agriculture, Ever David who works in agriculture, Jaime who works in agriculture, Alexander who works in agriculture, and Delmer Jose who works in agriculture.

Trojes, Honduras, September 2015.

loans.use: to plant a manzana [1.72 acres] of beans.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and has three children. She is widow and three of her children are got married.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Teresita requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through GDMPC to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from GDMPC to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 60 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, egg, etc.
