Estela has been in this business for 8 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, coffee, egg, etc

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Era works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Era is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Era has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Thorn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a factory laborer and seller to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Ulukmyrza

texts.ru: Улукмырза, 29 лет, женат, есть 2 детей. У него среднее образование. Улукмырза, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, стал заниматься животноводством и полеводством. У Улукмырзы есть 6 коров. На 0,90 Га земли он выращивает кукурузу и люцерну. Ежемесячная прибыль около 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Улукмырза обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Улукмырза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение его бизнеса и хочет накопить на постройку дома.
texts.en:
Ulukmyrza is 29 years old, married, and has two children. He has secondary education. Ulukmyrza, in search of income for his family, started working in animal husbandry and crop cultivation. Ulukmyrza has six cows. On 0.90 hectares of land, he cultivates corn and alfalfa. His monthly income is about 14,000 som (KGS). 

With the view of further developing his business, Ulukmyrza has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to buy three dairy cows for increasing the volume of organic milk sales. Ulukmyrza plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further expansion of his business, and he wants to save to build a house.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to increase the volume of organic milk sales.

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
Vorn’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vorn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Thola's Group

texts.en:
Thola’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province, in Cambodia.

Thola works as a factory laborer and she also does extra work as an ironmaker to support her family.

There is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water in Thola's village. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sok makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina lives in the rural town of Pilar, Bohol. She is married and has one grown child. Her husband's occupation is farming.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store and sells goods like sugar, powdered milk, biscuits, canned goods, candies, energy drinks, edible oil, soap, insect repellent, matches, toothpaste and toiletries.

For the past ten years, she has been serving neighbors and town dwellers. She faced a major challenge of not having enough liquid capital to expand.

Celestina decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost her business. She wants to buy groceries, drinks and canned goods. These will help maintain the content of her store and attract more buyers to come.

In the future, she is determined that she will become progressive as she keeps on handling her livelihood properly to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Souy's Group

texts.en: Souy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Souy makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Libertad

texts.en:
Libertad is 63 years old married woman who has five children to provide. She owns and manages her coco farm for many years. She has been selling charcoal also using the coconut shells. With her generated revenue, she were able to pay her previous loan used in the business and pay the school fees of her children.

She want to expand her business. Recently, she took a new loan to pay labor cost for her coconut farm for the land preparation. Libertad expects an increase in the harvest so as to expand her farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to pay labor cost for her coconut production

location.town: LOOC, LIBERTAD, SAPANG DALAGA, MISAMIS OCCIDENTAL

loans.name: Rorn's Group

texts.en: Rorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.  Rorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Savern's Group

texts.en: Savern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Savern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 52 years old and married with four children. Fely works very hard to provide for them.

Fely runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Fely has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Fely would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en: Phea’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phea works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Amtal

texts.en:
Amtal is the age of 37-years, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children; she is very hard work and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to run her household expenses. It is challenge for them to afford the school and tuition fee, so that both are doing a lot of hard work to run a setup of their house.

She owns a small beauty parlor at home and her husband is doing small job in a firm. Both are contribute their full income for household expenses. With the passage of time her beauty products are going to be finished and this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon.

Amtal requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will buy cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair colors, scissors and combs, for her salon. She hopes that through this amount she will be able to enhance her businesses.
She is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair colors, scissors etc for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 36 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 2000 года в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айнуры, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы. На 2,0 Га земли она выращивает рис и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров и сена для скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Ainura is 36 years old, married, and has two children. She has secondary education, and since 2000 she has been working in animal husbandry and crop cultivation as a source of income for her family, having started with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Ainura's persistent hard work, currently her farm has four cows. On 2.0 hectares of land, she cultivates rice and clover. Her monthly income is about 22,000 som (KGS). 

With the view of further developing her business, Ainura has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) in order to buy three cows, and hay for the livestock. She plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase three cows and hay for livestock in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Marwiyah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM Syariah’s clients, Marwiyah, who is a 50-year-old married woman with two sons. Marwiyah and her husband have been farmers for 10 years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 6,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Marwiyah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with adequate sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Mira

texts.ru: Мира, 30 лет, замужем, есть дочь школьница. У Миры среднее образование, с 2005 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец и лошадь. На 1,0 Га земли она выращивает рис. Благодаря упорному труду Миры, ее деятельность позволяет приносить около 19,000 сом в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и сена для откорма скота. Доходы от кредита Мира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность улучшить жилищные условия ее семьи.
texts.en:
Mira is 30 years old, married, and her daughter is a schoolgirl. Mira has secondary education, and since 2005 has been working in animal husbandry and crop cultivation. On her farm there are two cows, ten sheep, and a horse. On 1.0 hectares of land, she cultivates rice. Thanks to Mira's persistent hard work, her business is able to bring in about 19,000 som a month, which serves as the base for covering expenses for her family's food and daily needs. 

With the view of further developing her business, Mira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to buy two cows and hay for fattening up the livestock. Mira plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further augmentation of her business, in order to be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and hay for livestock in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Gorette

texts.fr:
Gorette est une femme courageuse et travailleuse de 39 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de deux enfants de 14 et 17 ans. Le dernier seulement va à l'école actuellement, l'aîné non plus et l'aide dans l'exercice de son activité.
Elle est marchand mobile des collations. C'est elle même et son enfant qui les préparent à son domicile et puis elle fait des portes à portes, va d'un bureau à un autre à toute heure du goûter pour les vendre. Une autre activité va être réalisée avec le prêt, elle va produire des pâtes alimentaires avec son fils. Avec lequel, elle va acheter une machine à pâte professionnel et quelques sacs de farine.
Avant tout ça, elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche, mais à cause du séquelle d'un accident en moto, elle ne pouvait plus.
Elle loue encore la maison dans laquelle tous les trois habitent, donc elle envisage et rêve de construire la sienne.
texts.en:
Gorette is a courageous and hard-working woman of 39. She is divorced and the mother of two children aged 14 and 17. Only the younger is presently in school. The older child, a son, no longer attends school and helps Gorette in her business.

Gorette is an itinerant seller of cooked snacks. She and her son prepare the food at their home and then she goes from door to door and from one office to another at break time to sell the food. Another business will come into being with this loan, as she is planning to make pasta together with her son. To that end, she will buy a professional pasta machine and some sacks of flour.

Before all that, Gorette worked in a company in the duty-free zone, but because of problems due to a motorcycle accident, she was no longer able to do that. She still rents the house all three of them live in, so she dreams of being able to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy a pasta machine and sacks of flour.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en: Shirly is 22 years old, married with one child, has been helping her husband working in their own farm for a living. To improve the farm, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer. She sells bananas in town and some will be for family consumption. In the future, she wants to cultivate her adjacent farm to ensure an improved and better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to fertilize sa field.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Edina works hard to support her family. She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store.

Edina is borrowing 10,000 PHP through GDMPC to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested this new loan to further build her business.

Edina has sustained her business activities through four prior loans from GDMPC. She hopes that her hard work will help her to realize her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 65 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Josefina works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods,  home product care, and other groceries.

Josefina has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods,  home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 53 and a mother of five children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a responsible to meet the needs of the entire family. Naseem owns a bangles shop. She has been running her shop for 8 years to help her husband meet the family’s expenses. Her bangles shop is very famous in the colony and that is the reason her business runs well and her sales have increased.
Now Naseem wants to invest further in her bangles shop for proper income but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to. Therefore Naseem has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Naseem can purchase more items to earn proper income.
Naseem and her family will be thankful to the KIVA, lender s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for bangles for her shop.

loans.name: Susilawati

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Susilawati, who is a 29-year-old. Susilaawati is a housewife and her husband is a driver for five years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.500,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah.

This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Susilawati will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Emeline

texts.en:
Emeline is a 22-year-old mother with two children. She runs and operates a small business of selling pancakes, buns, and pork cake in her community to earn a living.

Emeline requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, a fry pan, and vegetable oil to help her run the business.

She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, a wooden spoon, a fry pan, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Lorlinda

texts.en:
Lorlinda is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorlinda is 58 years old and has one child in school.

Lorlinda has a buy and sell cooked egg business in the Philippines. Lorlinda requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more egg to sell.

Lorlinda has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Lorlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 61 years old and married with four children. With three of her children in school, Enriqueta works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, where she sells a variety of items. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Enriqueta has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 42 years old and has two children. She is a single woman who is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Estrella has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Blenda Carolina

texts.es:
Blanca, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer humilde y trabajadora, estudio hasta sexto grado, ella quería seguir estudiando no logró seguir estudiando porque sus padres no tenían los suficientes recursos económicos, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor y albañil y solo tienen dos hijos.

Blanca, tiene una tienda con la que genera ingresos para su familia y los fines de semana se levanta muy temprano para hacer pupusas, mientras su esposo trabaja en el campo sembrando granos básicos.

Blanca, necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para poder tener bien surtida su tienda y negociar con nuevos productos.

Blanca, sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo y así mejorar las condiciones de su familia y que sus hijos tengan lo necesario para que puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Blenda, age 29, is a humble and hard-working woman who went to school up to sixth grade. She wanted to continue her studies, but she was not able to do so because her parents didn't have sufficient resources. She has a partner who is a farmer and mason, and they have only two children.

Blenda has a store with which she generates income for her family, and on the weekends she gets up very early to make pupusas [filled tortillas], while her husband works in the fields planting basic grains.

Blenda needs the loan to buy merchandise, in order to keep her store well-stocked and to offer new products.

Blenda's dream is that her business will continue to grow, and thus she will improve her family's situation, and her children will have what they need so that they can complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to keep her store well-stocked and offer new products.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is 42 years old woman, mother of three children and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is sells fruits e.g. apples, bananas, grapes etc.

Her husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that her husband can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase the fruits.

Therefore Musarat has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose.
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits her husband for increase his business

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Pho, 45, lives in Phnum Sruoch district, Kampong Speu province. She owns farmland which she grows rice and sell to the local dealers. Until now, it almost fifteen years that she has been being as a farmer. By working very hard, she is able to make approximately USD 2.5 per day.

Pho would like to improve her living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL.

After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and have less smoke from wood or charcoal. Thanks to the green loan program with a special rate offered by HKL, her family can gain access to a clean energy while protecting the environment.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Voluntarios Group

texts.es:
SHIRLEY Es una mujer de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, no tiene hijos y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por agrupar la mayor parte de la producción manufacturera en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo.
Shirley es de tez morena, cabello negro y baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como pintor de interiores, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. El deseo por generar mejores ingresos económicos la llevó a liderar una banca de emprendimiento con negocios como; taller de cerrajería, venta de ropa de segunda mano, confección de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, taller de llaves, venta de comida, venta de productos naturales para la salud, venta de huevo y taller de cambio de lubricantes. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, los productos más vendidos son, perfumes, lápiz labial, lápiz de ojos, pintura de uñas y otros, “vendo a crédito y al contado, cuento con rutas establecidas de clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que brinda facilidades para pagar, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar cosméticos por mayor y abastecer su negocio. Su sueño es abrir una tienda donde tenga vitrinas para visualizar los productos, ella desea comprar cosméticos de catálogo por mayor para ofertar a sus clientes en las fiestas navideñas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que  Shirley solicita un  préstamo para comprar cosméticos de catálogo para vender a crédito y al contado.
texts.en:
Shirley is a 28-year-old woman who lives with her husband and they have no children. Her business is selling cosmetics.

Shirley is enterprising, independent, and very persistent. Her business is carried out in the southern zone of the city, which is characterized as having the majority of the manufacturing production in the entire area, plus its very humid and hot tropical climate.

Shirley's complexion is dark, her hair black and she is short in stature. Her maternal tongue is Guarani but she also speaks Spanish. Shirley shares her life with her husband who works as an interior painter. They live in a room that belongs to the family. Its constructed of bricks and has potable water, electricity, and a tile floor.

A desire to generate better income led her to lead a micro-enterprise bank with small businesses such as; a locksmith's, selling second-hand clothes, selling natural foods for health, selling eggs, and an oil change and lube shop.

Shirley's business is selling cosmetics from a catalog. The products she sells most of include perfumes, lip pencils, eye pencils, nail polish, and other such items. She comments, "I sell for cash or credit, and I have established customer routes." Her business's advantage is that she allows time payments, while the disadvantage is her lack of money to purchase cosmetics at wholesale and re-supply her business.

Shirley's dream is to open a store containing glass cases so that customers can see her products. She wishes to buy cosmetics from a catalog at wholesale to offer her customers during the Christmas festivals. This will be her first loan administered through this institution during the two years she has been involved in this activity.

So, these are Shirley's motives for soliciting a loan -- to purchase cosmetics from a catalog to sell for cash or credit.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics from a catalog to sell for cash or credit.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vilma is 43 years old and has seven children who are in school.

Vilma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Vilma has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Bellie

texts.en:
Bellie is 51 years old and married with six children, two of whom in school, Bellie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Bellie has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Bellie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 54 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucresia requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucresia has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucresia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 38 years old, married and has four children. Three of her children are attend in school.

Remedios is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Remedios requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Remedios has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Sulastri

texts.en:
Sulastri is a 43-year-old married with two sons. Sulastri and her husband is an employee for twenty five years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Sulastri will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak, 22 years old father of two children, lives in Phnum Sruoch District, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is the owner of a small pig farm which was located behind his house. He can make a net profit approximately USD 3 a day.

During this time, he is faced with a financial issue in his family. He needs some money for raising baby pigs and sell to local dealers when they are big but he cannot afford to buy them. Therefore he has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help them. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to raise baby pigs and sell.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 66 years old and has three children. Lucresia is married woman.

Lucresia is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Lucresia requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Lucresia has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucresia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Cecili

texts.en:
Ma. Cecili is 44 years old and married with four children, three of whom in school, Ma. Cecili works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, chips, noodles, etc.

Ma. Cecili has been in this business for 14 years.

In the future Ma. Cecili would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, chips, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Yakubu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Yakubu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yakubu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/hectare, Yakubu hopes to realize better yields. He plans to use his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is responsible mother of 2 children, who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband who has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 14 years. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do this.

Therefore Nabeela has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Nabeela's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Nabeela also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Nabeela is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a 36-year-old married mother of six children, five in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Elma has a business farming coconuts in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Elma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lopepe

texts.en: Lopepe is a 56 year old mother with 5 children. She runs a business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Lopepe requested for a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves, chemicals, banana tube(seedling), to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2004.

loans.use: to buy backpack sprayer, taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and hand gloves, chemicals, banana tube(seedling),

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en:
Roldan was able to continue his ornamental and landscaping business through the support of Kiva and its lenders. This means a lot to him as this is his main source of income to support his family.

Once again Roldan would like to request for a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizer, pots, nets, and various seedlings to grow a variety of ornamental plants. Roldan puts his best efforts to growing healthy and beautiful plants to attract more customers. His income helps cover their daily expense and the school needs of his child.

Roldan aims to acquire a delivery truck. He prays for God to bless his business and have an abundant life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers & plant inputs for his landscaping business.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 47 year old married woman living with her husband and her five children, some of them are still studying at the university. Her husband is the main source income children to satisfy the family needs and being able to live in a good lifestyle and as per her she is dedicated only for her family. Today, in order to pay her daughter’s university fees, she is applying for a new loan. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to pay the fees and help her daughter continue her education.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s university fees.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a widow whose husband died some years ago from illness. Farida is raising her two children alone.

She works hard to earn a living and provides her children with all necessities. Farida has been busy buying and selling food items for more than two years. She sells food items in a market where she has a store. Farida sells a variety of food items and she periodically renews the assortment in her store.

Farida needs financial support because her son is ill. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to buy medicine for her son's treatment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy medicine forher son's treatment.

loans.name: Zenia

texts.en:
Zenia is 63 years old and a widow with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Zenia has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. Zenia requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more personal care products to offer for sale.

Zenia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Zenia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is 52 years old and has four children.  Welma is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Welma requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Welma has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 39 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Welma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 43 years old and married with seven children. With four children in school, Nelly works very hard to provide for them.

Nelly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Nelly has been in this business for 1 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Nelly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta lives with her family in Lahore. Her family comprises of her husband and their four children. She is 30 years old, enthusiastic, and responsible.

Shagufta has a small tailoring business that she operates from her house. Many ladies in her community together take orders, complete them, and distribute the money according to their contribution in the completion of the orders.

Shagufta is skilled and hardworking. Currently she wants to buy a new sewing machine in addition to the old one, as the old one doesn't work properly, hindering her work. Her income does not allow her to buy a machine, that is why she has applied for a loan that will help her buy a sewing machine.

Shagufta's dream is to give her children an education and earn a good living.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rasoazanamanana

texts.fr:
Rasoazanamanana a 48 ans actuellement. Elle est mariée (18 ans de mariage) et le couple a deux fils de 12 et 11 ans. Ces enfants sont tous scolarisés.
Auparavant , elle et son mari sont marchands de boissons hygiéniques (jus naturels faits maison). Et depuis 2013, elle est devenue marchand de légumes dans un grand marché de la capitale. L'idée est de diversifier  et améliorer l'activité source de revenu familial. C'est une amie qui lui a suggérer cette démarche.  Le prêt va lui permettre de mieux ravitailler les stocks de marchandises.
L'objectif du couple est d'améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille: épargner davantage afin de pouvoir acheter un terrain et construire une maison.
texts.en:
Rasoazanamanana is currently 48 years old. She has been married for 18 years and together they have two sons of 11 and 12 years old. The children are both in school.

Previously, she and her husband were selling healthy fruit juice drinks made from home. And since 2013, she became a vegetable merchant in a large market in the capital. The idea is to diversify and improve the source of revenue for the family. A friend suggested this process. The loan will help her to resupply her stocks of merchandise.

The couple's goal is to improve the family's quality of life by saving more in order to be able to purchase land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables: carrots, potatoes, zucchini, peas, Bambara peas, beans, leaf vegetables, etc..

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en:
Suraya is a 45-year-old woman and mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession. Her husband sells fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Suraya's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not in the condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose. Therefore Suraya has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits for her husband's business.

loans.name: Danny Maybeth

texts.es: La Sra. Danny es soltera pero vive con el padre de su hijo. La Sra. Danny actualmente trabaja y estudia para salir adelante, pues se embarazo muy joven y tuvo que trabajar mucho para mantener a su hijo. Es por eso que la Sra. Danny entro a capacitarse a un centro de enseñanza en la cual aprendió a conducir movilidad, para de esta forma pueda trabajar en un radio taxi (móvil) de pura mujeres que está promocionando ese centro, de esta forma mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y tener tiempo a disposición para que pueda también seguir estudiando. También la Sra. Danny recientemente a empezado a trabajar con la venta de calzados con un pequeño capital que logro reunir en los últimos años en su trabajo, negocio en el cual el padre de su hijo le está ayudando pero no ganan lo suficiente para poder mantener a su familia, es por eso que requiere el préstamo para comprara de la movilidad para tener un ingreso fijo y mejorar la calidad de vida
texts.en:
Danny is single but lives with the father of her son. Danny is currently working and studying to get ahead but she got pregnant very young and has had to work a lot to support her son. For this reason Danny started training at an academy to learn how to drive a vehicle. In this way she can work in a radio controlled taxi with all women drivers that the center is promoting. Doing this she can improve her family's quality of living and have free time to continue to study.

Danny also started to work selling footwear with a small capital she has manged to gather in the last years of work. The father of her son is helping with this business but it is not making enough to maintain the family. For this reason she needs the loan to buy the vehicle to have a regular income and improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle (taxi) to serve as transportation service and generate resources for her son.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is a married woman with 6 children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, soda, flour, milk, and other household items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation of goods to the shop.

Asteria requested a loan amount of 5000 to purchase groceries items. Her business goal is to be a supplier of goods within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to open a bigger business.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila owns a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic goods ranging from biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, powdered meals, and canned goods to soft drinks. In addition to that, she also engages in a food vending business. She sells snack food, catering mostly to locals in her place.

She is married and has two children. Her husband's way of earning is by being a construction worker.

She would like to improve both of her sources of income. She is determined that she could find ways to become successful.

Nila has requested a loan to buy supplies like soft drinks, groceries and ingredients for food vending. In that way, she could be able to provide a variety of snack food to sell. She could now have proper monitoring of merchandise available to prevent from shortage. Thus, her earnings will improve and she will continue to expand her livelihood.

She dreams that someday, she will become productive as she continues to handle her business to become successful.

loans.use: to buy supplies like soft drinks, groceries and ingredients for food vending.

loans.name: Mukhtara

texts.en:
Mukhtara is a 60-year-old lady and a responsible mother of seven sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her elder son has been running his own restaurant business for the past 22 years.

Mukhtara's son needs to purchase different types of merchandise, e.g., crockery, wood tables, chairs and food items, etc., for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means her son is unable to purchase this merchandise.

To fulfill this need, Mukhtara has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will help her son to buy this merchandise for his business purpose. That will be good for him to earn more income, and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Mukhtara is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's restaurant business.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is 48 and a mother of two sons and four daughters. They live in a populated area in Lahore. Her husband is a milkman and takes fresh milk to households and other businesses.

In order to increase sales, he needs to have more quantity of milk; therefore, he is planning to buy a buffalo. But due to financial constraints, he is not able to do so. In order to help her husband, Sakina has requested a loan so that he can buy a buffalo.

They are thankful to BRAC Pakistan and are hopeful to give a better future to their children.

loans.use: to help her husband with his milk selling business by buying a buffalo.

loans.name: Shaila's Group

texts.en:
Shaila's husband is an auto-rickshaw driver in Lahore. Shaila is 40 years old and is a housewife. The only source of income for her family comes through her husband's driving his rickshaw. Her husband is a hardworking person. He provides pick-up and drop-off services to students and also provides transportation to people within Lahore.

Since his old rickshaw is worn out Shaila's husband needs to purchase another one. Lack of savings does not allow him to buy a new rickshaw. Shaila has therefore requested for a loan from a nearby branch of BRAC {akistan, a Kiva field partner, to help her husband. They are happy and thankful for your assistance.

loans.use: to help her husband buy a rickshaw.

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es: Martha tiene 42 años de estado civil casada su esposo es albañil, tiene 2 hijas Abigail de 6 años  Marisol de 13 ellas estudian en unidades educativas del sector, ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa luego de ser empleada por 20 años  decidió crear su pequeño taller de confección Martha necesita el dinero para comprar telas y ofrecer a sus clientes una gama donde escojan el tipo que deseen, aumentando sus ganancias ayudando a su esposo a cubrir los principales gastos del hogar en esta temporada que para él está muy difícil encontrar trabajo.
texts.en:
Martha is 42 years old and she is married. Her husband is a construction worker. She has 2 daughters: Abigail who is 6 years old and Marisol who is 13 years old. They both attend school. Martha works making all types of clothing. After having been an employee for 20 years, she decided to open her own small workshop.
Martha needs the finances to buy material and offer her customers a variety of clothing from which they can chose what they like. This will increase her earnings and allow her to help her husband in covering the costs of the home as it has been very difficult for him to find work during this season.

loans.use: to buy material that she can offer to her customers.

loans.name: Gulchohra

texts.en: Gulchohra is a 50-year-old lady. Gulchohra is a very young, energetic person. She is a farmer. She loves her job a lot. She has been involved in raising cattle and sheep. She makes them fat. Gulchohra gets her family's support. She loves her job. She needs a 1,500 AZN loan. This loan will be used to buy two calves. KIVA lenders should support her.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Maysoun

texts.en: Maysoun is a 30 year old married woman of one child. Her husband represents the main income source for the family in order to fulfil their family needs and being always ready to meet always their demands. He works as an employee and his income is barely sufficient. That’s why, today, in order to pay her child’s study fees; she is applying for a new loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she will be able to help him and ensure him a suitable educational path, and that’s her only target.

loans.use: to pay her child’s study fees

loans.name: Adeliza

texts.en:
Adeliza is 36 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Adeliza works very hard to provide for them.

Adeliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Adeliza has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Adeliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Anunciacion

texts.en:
Anunciacion is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anunciacion is 60 years old and still has one child in school.

Anunciacion has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, oil, etc.

Anunciacion has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Rose is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Mary Rose has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna is the age of 40. She is the mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has sold fresh fruits in a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop.

Nowadays, the needs of Amna's family suddenly increased and her husband does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock so that he can maximize sales out of the fruits on a daily basis.

Therefore, Amna requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy extra seasonal fruits. Amna thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband by fruits for his business.

loans.name: Mayleen

texts.en:
Mayleen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Mayleen has been in this business for one year. Mayleen earns more income from buying and selling charcoal and general loan.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jamilu

texts.en:
Jamilu is a maize farmer from magami village. As a Babban Gona member, Jamilu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Jamilu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Jamilu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Jamilu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Jamilu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita owns a sari-sari(variety) store, selling goods ranging from biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, tooth paste, shampoo and toiletries.
She lives in the rural area of Dagohoy, Bohol with his husband, who is a farmer and two grown children. She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for many years and she is responsible for feeding her family.

She decided to increase her current business. Therefore, Lucita is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner CEVI because she has to purchase groceries for the store. In this way she would be able to cope with demands. She can use the profit amount as savings to fulfill the future needs as well.

Lucita is very thankful to Kiva and CEVI.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her store.

loans.name: Suzeline Ginah

texts.fr:
Suzeline est une jolie femme de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et son époux est marchand de téléphones portables et accessoires téléphoniques. Le couple a trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés dans une école privée, ils onnt 6 et 9 ans. Le dernier a 3 ans et ne va pas encore à l'école.
Auparavant, elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche, et après la naissance de son dernier enfant, elle s'est arrêtée et choisissait d'entrer dans le secteur commerce. Depuis lors, elle est devenue marchand ambulant de sous-vêtements (slips, boxers, chaussettes). C'est une femme ayant une bonne présentation et une bonne attitude commerciale, elle est souriante, accueillante et belle. Son objectif est d'acquérir un lieu de vente fixe, une boutique.
texts.en:
Suzeline is a pretty lady of thirty years of age. She is married and her husband sells cell phones and phone accessories. The couple have three children, of whom two are attending a private school. They are 6 and 9 years old. The youngest is 3 years old and doesn't go to school yet.

Earlier, Suzeline worked in a company in the duty-free zone, but after the birth of her last child, she quit and decided to go into small-scale commerce. Ever since, she has been an itinerant saleswoman selling underwear (panties, boxer shorts, and socks.) She is a woman who presents herself well and has a good attitude as a salesperson. She is smiling, welcoming, and attractive. Her goal is to acquire a fixed sales point, that is, a shop.

loans.use: to buy underwear and socks for sale as an itinerant sales person.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is 26 years old and has three children. Irish is married and has two children who are in school.

Irish is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Irish requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Irish has been in this bussiness for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Irish would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna is 43 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lorna has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending like spices, etc..

Lorna has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending like spices, etc.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 63 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

For four years Dolores has been operating a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, personal care products and school supplies. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

In the future, Dolores would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.en:
Zaynab, who was born in 1961, is married and has two children. She is the main supporter of her family as her husband, a teacher in a local school, earns only a small salary.

For more than 10 years Zaynab has been busy raising cows and selling the milk and milk products in a local market. She takes pleasure in her enterprise, which her husband helps her manage.

Zaynab is requesting a loan of 3300 Somoni to pay for her son's university tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Gulsanam

texts.en:
Gulsanam is 59 years old, married, and the mother of three beautiful children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.

Gulsanam and her husband have their own business, earning income to meet their family's needs. She has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 14 years. During these years, she gained the necessary skills and knowledge for the effective management of her business. She usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar.

She also makes homemade yogurt and sells it, along with fresh milk, to her neighbors. Her monthly income is about AZN 144.

This business is the family's only source of income. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan since people use it in everyday dishes, like pilau (a rice dish) and dolma (stuffed grape leaves).

Now, Gulsanam would like to buy more animals. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of AZN 1,500. She will buy three calves and one milk cow. This will be her sixth loan with AqroInvest Credit Union and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy three calves and one milk cow

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 29 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three children who are still studying. She is a housewife taking care of her children all the time. Her husband is the main income provider in the family and working so hard to help his beloved family to live in good conditions.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s school educational fees. The parents’ only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation

loans.use: to pay her children’s school educational fees

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn is 34 years old and married, with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Romelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Romelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her pig-fattening business.

Genelyn dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ana Del Rocio

texts.es: Ana del Roció tiene 39 años de edad, es de estado civil casada, su esposo es ayudante de bus, tienen una hija, Pamela de 15 años de edad, Ana se dedica hace 5 años a la comercialización de papas, gracias a este duro trabajo ella ha podido ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar, en especial en la educación de su hija, ella solicita el crédito para incrementar su negocio y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana del Roció is 39 years old and she is married. Her husband works as a bus assistant. They have one daughter, Pamela, who is 15 years old.
Ana has worked selling potatoes for 5 years. Thanks to this hard work she has been able to help her husband with the expenses of their home, especially with her daughter's education.
She is requesting the loan to expand her business and as a result increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy and sell potatoes.

loans.name: Tauvaimealelei

texts.en: Tauvaimealelei is a 32-year-old mother with four children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. Tauvaimealelei requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals and a backpack sprayer to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Mikongeni Group

texts.en:
Mariam is in her early 40's and a widow with two schooling kids. She has been supporting her family by running a shop selling soft drinks, beer, and spirits.

She has been in this business for nine years now, working from 6 AM to 6 PM per working day. In a good working day, Mariam is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This is her first credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Mkongeni 's two-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

In the coming years, she would like to manage a big business to be able to supply stock to her customers. Mariam will invest part of her credit to buy and resell soft drinks, beer, and spirits.

loans.use: to buy and resell soft drinks, beer, and spirits.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 43 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. Her business is selling cereals and farming. She has been in the business for five years. She earns a monthly income of 4,000 KES.

This is her second term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of maize, beans, green grams, and cow peas for sale.

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and fully educate her children to protect them from poverty.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of cereals

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 29 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for two years. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000 (fifteen thousand Kenya shillings).

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy seeds and water tanks for irrigation. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hope and dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and water tanks for irrigation.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ruby has a buy-and-sell organic fertilizer business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more organic fertilizer to sell.

Ruby has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more organic fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.en:
Ederlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like wood, paints, and fishing net for her fishing business.

Ederlinda has been in this business for 19 years. She earns more income from buy-and-sell fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ederlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like wood, paints, and fishing net for her fishing business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, and spices.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like pig-fattening.

Emma dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, and spices.

loans.name: Ariel Dario

texts.es: Ariel es un joven de 23 años que se encuentra comprometido con su cónyuge y reside en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla, se vio forzado a renunciar de su trabajo para continuar con sus estudios, puesto que estaba teniendo múltiples inconvenientes que no le estaban permitiendo cumplir con sus compromisos académicos, en concordancia tomó su liquidación y vendió un vehículo propio para contar con el capital necesario y emprender su proyecto de negocio una mini tienda de víveres y comercio de relojes.  Este valeroso joven diariamente recibe a vecinos y transeúntes del sector que desean comprar víveres y productos de aseo a partir de las 7 a.m. y también cuenta con el apoyo de su familia quienes le colaboran en la atención del negocio cuando se encuentra estudiando. Alternamente ofrece por medio de las redes sociales relojes de distintas marcas que comercializa entre sus conocidos y referidos, para cancelar a cuotas.  En la actualidad desea ampliar su negocio y aplicó a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar estanterías y surtirlas con víveres, productos de aseo y otros productos que le han solicitado sus clientes.  Su principal meta es terminar sus estudios y ofrecerles bienestar a su esposa y a su hijo que está por nacer.
texts.en: Ariel is a 23-year-old young man who is engaged to his partner and lives in a neighborhood south of Barranquilla.  He became forced to resign from his job in order to continue his studies, since he was facing multiple obstacles to completing his academic commitments.  Accordingly, he took his severance pay and sold his own vehicle to have the necessary capital to start his business project: a mini shop for food supplies and the sale of watches.  Each day from 7 A.M. this brave young man welcomes neighbors and passers-by from the area who want to buy food supplies and cleaning products.  He also counts on the support of his family, who help tend to the business when he is studying.  Alternately, he sells watches from different brands through social media, marketing them to his acquaintances and referred customers in order to settle installment payments.  Currently, he wishes to expand his business and applied to his first credikiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy shelving units and supply them with food supplies, cleaning products and other products that his customers have requested.  His main goal is to finish his studies and provide well-being for his wife and unborn child.

loans.use: to buy shelving units and supply them with food supplies, cleaning products, and other products that his customers have requested.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is a farmer in Garang, Tangub City. She has a vegetable farm and primarily grows bitter gourds, bottle gourds, squash, eggplant, sweet peppers and others. She supplies vegetables in their local market and is financed by Paglaum MPC. Recently, she availed herself of a loan from the coop to purchase bags of fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and pesticides.

location.town: Tangub - Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of five thousand Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and a water pump. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a water pump for her farm.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and her three children are still in school. Nancy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through GDMPC to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nancy has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed from GDMPC to sustain it. In the future, Nancy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 36, a married woman, and has three children to provide for. To earn a living, she engages in planting and harvesting bananas and selling them in the market. She earns a lot from this activity. In fact, she was able to send her children to school and provide for her daily needs. She wants to expand her business and to engage in other businesses. Recently, she took a new loan to pay the replanting cost of her bananas in order to provide more bananas in the market.

Mary Jane's plan for the future is to save more money and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the replanting cost of her bananas.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 48 years old now and works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Susana has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional cosmetics and other products for her beauty parlor business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetics and other products for her beauty parlor business

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen, age 34, is a married woman and mother of two children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother she wants to provide better facilities to her children, this is the reason she is doing extra ordinary hard work to keep smiling at her children.

She began sewing clothes after birth of her two children, when she observed that her husband's income failed to provide all necessities to her children. Then she decided to start tailoring work at home and now she sews the clothes of her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her stitching, so she wants to buy a Juki brand sewing machine because it provides speed and quality stitches. She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community.

Shaheen has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. Shaheen is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her tailoring services.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is 24 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional supplies to sell like coffee, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Renalyn has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from a buy-and-sell charcoal business.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies to sell like coffee, sugar, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Lynlyn

texts.en:
Lynlyn is 24 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Lynlyn has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell dried fish.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Thembi

texts.en:
Thembi (49) is a single mother to 3 girls aged 29, 25 and 8 years old. For the last 15 years she has raised her daughters from the income she's made running a daycare center from her backyard. The center has grown steadily over the years and has a good reputation, playing a positive and active role within the community.

She is requesting for a Kiva loan to buy an outdoor swing set. "A big challenge for me is not having enough resources for the children. This loan will help me provide better activities for them" says Thembi.

Her ambition is to start an orphanage looking after destitute children in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy and install an outdoor swing set combo

loans.name: Noela

texts.en: Noela is a 34-year-old woman with four children. She runs a business selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Noela requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine to assist her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers and a printing machine.

loans.name: Never Give Up Group

texts.en:
Hiệu is 34 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hiệu has been working in agriculture, raising cattle for seven years. Her family is a low income household in the village; moreover, this business has a very long capital turnover and if some disease to cattle happens, the income will be uncertain. So this job contains many risks.
