Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten  financiarse y no pagar muchos intereses. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The credit group "Vida Nueva" [New Life] meets every two weeks in the canton of Jaramijo. The area is known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of its inhabitants are very hard-working and make a living from the sea.

Ronald lives in this area. He is 19 years old, single, and lives in his parents' house. He is studying fishery biology at the local university.

Ronald is a very hard-working young man. He likes to get ahead through his own efforts and constantly work toward a better future, for when it is his time to start a family.

In addition to dedicating himself to his studies, he also works in sales. He has a small store in his house, where he sells rice, sugar, oils, and many other basic necessities, with his mom's help. Although he is able to be up-to-date on his store, his mom always helps him because he needs to leave for classes. For 3 years, he has worked in this business in order to pay for school.

This loan is to buy rice, sugar, and other supplies to stock his business and increase his variety of products. He has been in the credit group for 3 loan cycles, and he likes it because the loans allow him to finance himself without paying a lot of interest. His dreams are to finish school and be a good professional.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other supplies

loans.name: Myrlina

texts.en:
Myrlina works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase cloth, threads, and other materials for dressmaking.

Myrlina has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Myrlina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, threads, and other materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Ma. Elizadie

texts.en:
Ma. Elizadie is a hardworking entrepreneur who for the last four years has operated a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She also earns income from rice retailing.

Ma. Elizadie has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and with the help of loans from Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 15,000 PHP in order to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari. She is saving money in the hopes of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre LAS LUCHADORAS está en su ciclo 4º del programa de comité de mujeres, están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que a través de su encuesta de 50 indicadores permite a cada miembro conocer su situación de vida y conforme a ello poder unirse para trabajar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias. 
La Sra. Marina, es una  las integrantes quien se dedica a vender prendas usadas, y comenta que le va muy bien ya que la venta de prendas de segunda son muy solicitada hoy en día. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por su familia para poder darle todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas usadas en cantidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y dar una buena variedad a sus clientes y seguir teniendo los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
The group named "Las Luchadoras" [The Fighters] is in its 4th cycle of the women's group program. They are also in the poverty elimination program. Through its 50-question survey, the program allows each member to distinguish her living situation and set to work accordingly, in order to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Marina is one of the members. She works selling used clothes, and she says that it is going very well for her because secondhand clothes are very popular these days. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who works hard for her family, in order to give them everything that she wasn't able to have.

She is requesting this loan to buy wholesale used clothing, so that she can continue her sales, give her customers a good variety, and continue making income for her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale used clothing to sell

loans.name: Guzal

texts.en:
Guzal is a responsible mother of three children. She is repeat client of Imon. Guzal has a good credit history. She has used her previous loans for developing her business. Guzal has been busy feeding cattle for more than four years. She lives with her children and husband in a village. Her husband helps her feed the cattle. They work hard to earn a living.

Guzal and her husband need financial support because her little son is ill. Guzal is asking for a loan of 4,500 Somoni to buy medicines for the treatment of her son. She awaits your mercy because Kiva lenders are the only ones who can help her.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her son's treatment.

loans.name: Arlina

texts.en:
Arlina is 37 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Arlina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Arlina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Norema

texts.en:
Norema is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net, gasoline and bamboo for her fishing business.

Norema has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net, gasoline and bamboo.

loans.name: Norhaina

texts.en:
Norhaina is married and works hard to support her family. For the past twenty years she has dried and sold fish to earn a living in the Philippines.

Norhaina has applied for a 13,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to dry and sell. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 63 years old, married and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Corazon has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 60-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one son and two daughters. Her son has been running his own business selling garment clothes for 20 years. Her son is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Her son needs to purchase different types of garment clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these garment clothes. Therefore, Shehnaz is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her son to purchase these garment clothes in bulk for his business. Her son can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's garment clothing business by buying clothes in bulk

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Brave and hardworking, Shazia runs a canteen at a nearby school in Lahore. She is 44 and a mother of three sons and two daughters; she has always been supportive of her family. She is nice and friendly.

Shazia sells packed snacks, candies, biscuits, drinks and other local snacks to the students. Students enjoy the snacks she sells at her canteen and come running towards her canteen at lunch time. She enjoys serving them. She also has a small portion for notebooks, pens and pencils. Her hard work inspires many.

Shazia wants to give her children a higher education. Though her income is not much, she is happy to be able to make money for her family. She is not afraid of challenges. She wants to increase the sale of snacks for which she has requested a loan. She will pay it off with the income that she earns from the canteen.

loans.use: to buy materials to sell more snacks in her canteen.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Oñondivepa, está en su ciclo 15 dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas realizan actividades y mantienen un buen trabajo en equipo con el cual todas asumen su responsabilidad solidaria, y la de ayudarse entre todas. Se fijaron como meta poder crecer no solo en lo económico sino también como personas.
La. Sra. Mabel es una persona que  gracias a su constancia, esfuerzo y apoyo de sus compañeras ha logrado salir adelante, y mejorar sus ingresos. Se dedica a las costuras, hace todo tipo de confecciones, y por medio de su humilde trabajo da a su familia una modesta vida, pero sin privaciones. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar y crecer para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de hilos, telas, gomas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones, y cumplir con el amplio pedido de sus clientes. Todas están contentas por capacitarse y mejorar en sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
The "Oñondivepa" Group is in its 15th loan cycle in the women's group program. All the members have a job and work well as a team, with everyone helping each other and assuming their responsibility in solidarity. They set a goal to grow not only economically, but also as people.

Mabel is someone who, thanks to her determination, effort, and support from her companions, has succeeded in getting ahead and improving her income. She makes a living by sewing. She makes all kinds of clothes and through her humble work, she provides her family with a modest life, but without being deprived. She is thankful for her opportunity to improve and grow, in order to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy thread, cloth, elastic, etc. to be able to continue making clothes and fill her customers' many orders. All the members are happy to empower themselves and improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy thread, cloth, elastic, and other supplies to continue making clothes

loans.name: Pepita

texts.en:
Pepita is married and has four children, three of whom are still attending school. Her husband is a carpenter. For many years now she has earned a living by operating a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She sells commodities like eggs, cooking oil, sugar, seasonings, bars of soap, candies, chips and cookies.

Pepita joined CEVI in order to acquire a loan to boost her business. She took out and successfully repaid a previous loan, and now she is applying for a 6,000 PHP loan to restock her store with a variety of goods such as groceries, beverages, condiments and toiletries. More stock would help her increasingly meet her customers’ needs, improve her earnings and continue to satisfy the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to restock her store with a variety of goods.

loans.name: Hazel Divine

texts.en:
Hazel Divine is a married woman with three children. Hazel Divine is 33 years old and all three children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Hazel Divine has a food vending business in the Philippines. Hazel Divine requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Hazel Divine has been in this business for four years. In the future, Hazel Divine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Zaripahan

texts.ru: Зарипахан, 40 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей, она ответственная, честная и трудолюбивая. Образование средне-специальное, на протяжении 25 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Зарипахан, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы и 20 овец. Выращивает арбузы, дыни, кукурузу на 1,0 Га земли. Прибыль от ведения бизнеса составляет 17,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зарипахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян лука и удобрений для обработки земли и выращивания экологически-чистой продукции. Зарипахан планирует доходы от кредита вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на реконструкцию дома.
texts.en:
Zaripahan is 40, married, and the mother of five children.  She is responsible, honest and hardworking.  She has a specialized secondary education and she has been involved in agriculture for the past 25 years.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has four cows and 20 sheep on her farm.  She also grows watermelon, cantaloupe, and corn on one hectare of land.  Her farming business brings her a monthly income of 17,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her farming business, Zaripahan has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy onion seeds as well as fertilizers in order to cultivate her land and grow organic produce.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business, which will in turn help her to save enough money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds as well as fertilizers to cultivate her land and grow organic produce.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Gracias Group

texts.es:
CEl grupo Virgen de las Gracias en su ciclo número 1ro Del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza con el fin de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.Nelida quien vende perfumes variados, y gracias al trabajo que tiene da a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante. 
Nelida pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con colonias variadas, perfumes, fragancias y otros, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
CEI group "Virgen de las Gracias" (Virgin of the Graces) is in its first cycle of the program of the committee of women.  They are part of a program to eliminate poverty with the goal of being able to improve their living conditions and that of their loved ones.

One of the members is la Señora Nelida who sells a variety of perfumes, and thanks to the job that she has, she gives a dignified life without hardships to her family.  She is putting forth her best effort to be able to grow and get ahead.

Nelida is requesting this loan to be able to stock herself with various colognes, perfumes, fragrances and others, and in that way be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.  She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to continue growing and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy various colognes, perfumes, fragrances, and other types of perfumes to be able to continue with her sales.

loans.name: Magdaleno

texts.es:
El señor Magdaleno es reciclador, inicio su trabajo de reciclaje juntando latitas que hacía de manera ambulante,  de a poco se hizo de un carrito en el cual todos los días salía a trabajar, gracias a su perseverancia y esfuerzo pudo comprarse una motoneta el cual le ayuda a juntar más latitas. 
Pide este préstamo para poder refaccionar su vivienda, quiere comprar ladrillos, cementos y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en:
El señor Magdaleno is a recycler.  He began his job of recycling by collecting cans that he found in the street.  Soon, he made a little cart in which he would go out to work every day.  Thanks to his perseverance and effort, he was able to buy himself a scooter which helps him to pick up more cans.

He is requesting this loan to be able to make repairs on his home.  He wants to buy bricks, cement, and other supplies.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he receives to be able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To make home repairs, to buy bricks and cement.

loans.name: Cesar Leonor

texts.es:
El Sr. Cesar es de la ciudad de Luque, es mecánico de automóviles, y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia, comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior compró repuestos de vehículos para poder cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
Cesar pide este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar de vuelta repuestos para vehículos, y de esa forma poder seguir con su buen servicio. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
El Señor Cesar is from the city of Luque.  He is an automobile mechanic.  Through his job, he has the means to be able to support his family.  He says that through the previous loan, he bought spare parts for vehicles to be able to fulfill the requests of his customers.

Cesar is requesting this new loan to be able to buy more spare parts for vehicles, and in that way be able to continue with his good service.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he receives to be able to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for vehicles.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre San Miguel está en su primer ciclo  trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, mejorando su calidad de vida saliendo de la línea de pobreza. Son mujeres muy sacrificadas que se esfuerzan por crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Blanca, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas variadas, ella misma todos los días se levanta a preparar las comidas y luego las vende de manera ambulante por todo su barrio. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que se esfuerza por sus seres queridos para poder darles cada día una mejor calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos y otros productos y de esa manera poder seguir esforzándose por mejorar. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group called "San Miguel" is in its first cycle working through the program to eliminate poverty, improving their quality of life and getting out of the line of poverty.  They are very sacrificing women who strive to grow and get ahead.

One of the members is la señora Blanca who works selling a variety of foods.  Everyday she gets up to prepare the food and later to sell it in the streets of her neighborhood.  She is a very sacrificing woman who strives for her loved ones to be able to give them a better quality of life everyday.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy imput to make her food, such as vegetables, meats, condiments and other products, and in that way be able to continue striving to improve.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she receives to improve her living conditions and that of her loved ones.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and other products to make foods.

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is a 35-year-old married man from Dier El Balah city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family standard of living help them live more comfortably.
 
Basem took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN in order to buy water tank and a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Basem will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.
 
Basem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy water tank and a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing to sell such as jeans, shirts, pants, and other clothing items.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Esperanza es un grupo nuevo formado gracias a los deseos de superación de cada una de las integrantes de este grupo. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza esforzándose por crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Jovina quien es vendedora ambulante de frutas, ella es la presidenta de este grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que gracias a sus ansias de mejorar pone todo de si para poder crecer y salir adelante. Comenta que por medio de su sacrificio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.
La Sra. Jovina solicita  este préstamo para la compra de frutas en cantidad: por bolsas o en cajas para mejorar su costo y obtener mayor ganancia, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group called La Esperanza [Hope] was newly formed thanks to each of its members' desire for personal growth . They are in a program for the elimination of poverty and are working to grow and get ahead.

One of the members, Jovina, is a street vendor who sells fruits, and is also the president of this group. She is a very hardworking and persevering woman. Thanks to her desire to improve and get ahead, she is putting forth all her effort so that she can grow and get ahead. She says that through her sacrifices, she has been able to provide for her family.

Jovina is requesting this loan so that she can buy fruit in bulk: by the bag-full or in boxes, so that she can increase her costs and earn better earnings. She is thankful for the opportunity to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fruits by the bag-full or in boxes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama María Auxiliadora, son  de la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, manifiestan que están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres para que puedan ellas aumentar sus ingresos y ser cada vez más independientes en sus emprendimientos.
La Sra. Teresita es la presidenta del grupo, ella vive con sus hijos y su marido en casa propia, todos en la casa colaboran en el desarrollo y el crecimiento del nivel de vida de la familia. Ella tiene una olería en la que trabaja de manera incansable para poder dar a su familia lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar arcilla para poder seguir trabajando en su olería. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called María Auxiliadora is from the city of San Ignacio. They are united and supportive towards each other. They work together on rojects and express that they are comfortable and feel supported by the women's committee program. Through this, they can improve their income and become more and more independent in their entrepreneurial undertakings.

Teresita is the president of the group. She lives with her children and her husband in their own home. The entire household contributes to the growth and development of their quality of life. She has a brick-making business in which she works in a tireless manner to provide her family with the things she was not able to have.

She is requesting this loan to buy clay to continue working in her brick-making business. She is thankful for the opportunity she has received to continue working as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to buy clay to make clay bricks.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a la construcción y también al flete, comenta que por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna. El comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo comprar maderas para usar en sus construcciones lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
En este nuevo préstamo Juan quiere poder invertirlo en la compra de hierros, y de esa forma poder usarlo en sus construcciones. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan has been working in construction for more than 20 years and also works in transportation. Through his work he has the means to give his loved ones everything they need to live a decent life. With his previous loan he was able to buy wood to use in his construction which was very helpful to him.

Juan will use this new loan to invest in buying iron to use in construction. He is thankful for the opportunity he receives to be able to keep working.

loans.use: to buy iron to use in construction.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 53 years old, married, and has 2 children, with one child attending school.  Lolita works very hard to provide for her children, and for 5 years she has operated a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

Lolita has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Las Divinas, está conformado por 16 integrantes, se encuentran en el segundo ciclo; todas están con muy buenas expectativas sobre las actividades que están llevando a cabo, cada una tiene sus metas propias para lograr mejorar la situación de vida de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes de este comité es la Sra. Lilia, ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de pizzas caseras, cuenta con un pequeño local donde todos los días muchos clientes se acercan a comer las delicias que prepara. Comenta que gracias a sus ventas tiene los medios para poder crecer y salir adelante. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, queso, huevos, verduras, condimentos y otros productos, de manera a poder seguir haciendo sus pizzas para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group is called Las Divinas and is composed of 16 members. They are in their second cycle and they all have very good expectations about the work they are doing. Each one has her own goal in order to improve the living conditions of their families.

Lilia is one of the members of this group. She works making and selling homemade pizzas. She has a small shop where every day many customers come to eat the delicacies she prepares. Thanks to her sales she has the means to be able to grow and get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy flour, cheese, eggs, vegetables, spices, and other products so that she can continue making pizzas for sale. She is thankful for the opportunity she receives to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make pizzas such as flour, cheese, eggs, vegetables, spices, and other products.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
La Sra. Griselda tiene  39 años ,  ella es soltera y tiene una hija en edad escolar , por quien lucha, para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida, y que no tenga que pasar por necesidades. Griselda trabaja en un laboratorio y los fines de semana se dedica a realizar decoraciones de cumpleaños, quince años y otros eventos.
Gracias  al trabajo que está  realizando pueden llevar una vida digna y darle un techo a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas para poder usar en las decoraciones, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Griselda is 39 years old. She is single and has a school-age daughter for whom she struggles to provide a better quality of life for so that she doesn't lack anything. Griselda works at a laboratory and on the weekends she makes birthday decorations for sweet sixteens and other events. Thanks to her work they can lead a dignified life and she can provide a roof for her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric to use for decorations which will be very helpful. She is thankful for the opportunity she receives that allows her to establish her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabric to make decorations.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN FRANCISCO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adela es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de repuestos para movilidades, servicio de fotocopiadora, servicio de internet, venta de coca, venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de ropa, venta de frazadas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adela es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus amigas y decidió emprender su propio negocio hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será  para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro dentro de su Banca Comunal.
texts.en:
The communal association San Francisco will start its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the focal center of Alta Lima. The association is made up of eight members and is headed by a board where Adela is the secretary. The businesses that the members carry forward are varied and among them are the sale of blankets, the sale of spare parts for cell phones, photocopy services, internet services, sale of coca leaves, sale of cleaning supplies, and the sale of clothing.

The loan that they are requesting will benefit small business owners and Adela as a member. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for six months. She joined through a promotional invitation that the institution had in her area. She currently makes fabrics and sells blankets. She learned this business from her friends and decided to start her own business several years ago.

The loan will be used to increase her capital (to purchase wool wholesale) which she will buy from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. After production, she will sell in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate income to financially support her family since she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes saving in her communal bank.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO RENACER” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silvia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chuño, venta de mantas, venta de tucumanas, servicio de café, venta de comida, venta de salteñas, venta de dulces, venta de zapatos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silvia es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con un poco capital con el que contaba hace cinco años, este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association Nuevo Renacer will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the focal center Collpani. It is made up of eight members and is headed by a board where Silvia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry on are varied and among them are the sale of potato flour, sale of blankets, sale of tucumanas (empanadas), a cafe, sale of food, sale of meat pies, sale of candy, and sale of shoes.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners and Silvia as a member. She joined Pro Mujer after being invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a fabric business and sells blankets. She started this business five years ago with the very little capital she had. She learned this business from her mother.

This loan is to increase her capital (to buy wool wholesale) which she will buy from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. After production she will sell in her stall. This type of work allows her to generate income to financially support her family since she lives with her partner and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sandals.

loans.name: Kholida

texts.en:
Kholida is a young and clever woman. She is single and lives with her parents in a village in Tajikistan. Kholida is a student at Tajikistan State University, where she studies economics. Kholida has always dreamt of getting a higher education. Her studies are going well, and she is one of the successful students.

After graduating university, Kholida wants to work in the banking system. Her parents have no money to pay for her university tuition. Kholida is asking for a loan of 3500 TJS to pay her tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 56 years old, married, and has four children who are all still in school.

Oscar is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. He requested a 60,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Oscar has been in this business for 30 years now, and he has previously borrowed from GDMPC eight times to sustain his business.

In the future, Oscar would like to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 57 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming fruit in the Philippines. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lourdes has been farming fruit for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Robita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Robita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from planting vegetables. Robita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy bamboo, nails, and fish net to make fish cages for her fishing business.

Robita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, nails, and fish net to make fish cages.

loans.name: Marie Milette

texts.fr:
Marie a 32 ans, elle est mariée. Le mari l’appui dans l’activité : approvisionnement direct auprès des producteurs et transport des produits d’autres collecteurs. Le couple a trois garçons (12-10-3 ans) dont deux  scolarisés dans une école privée.
Elle est grossiste dans la vente de fruits. C’est une femme qui n’hésite pas à saisir les opportunités qui lui sont offertes : vente de pistaches de 2004 à 2006. De 2006 à 2008, elle vendait aux consommateurs les ananas. Depuis 2009 à ce jour, elle est devenue grossiste dans ce commerce ; l’activité a beaucoup évolué. Les prêts antérieurs lui ont permis ce développement par l’augmentation de la quantité des marchandises. 
La famille vit dans une maison en bois construite sur un terrain loué. L’objectif est l’extension de l’activité  dans le but de pouvoir créer une unité d’élevage porcin de  Le rêve du couple étant de pouvoir construire une maison dans la capitale.
texts.en:
Marie is thirty-two years old and married to a man who works with her in her wholesale business. The couple have three sons (twelve, ten and three years old), two of their boys attend a private school. Marie never hesitates to take advantage of opportunities offered to her - from 2004 to 2006 she sold pistachio nuts, from 2006 to 2008 she sold pineapples to the general public, since 2009 her business has evolved greatly and she now operates as a fruit wholesaler.

Marie's previous loans have enabled her to increase the volume of produce she sells. Currently, the family lives in a wooden house built on a rented plot of land. Their aim is to expand their business and begin raising pigs. The resulting profits will allow them to build a new home.

loans.use: to buy pineapples.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a 30-year-old married man from Rafah city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all his family's needs. However, he wants to improve his family's standard of living and help them live more comfortably.

Musa took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar water system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Musa will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing electricity expenses.

Musa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar water heating system for the family house.

loans.name: Ma. Elenita

texts.en:
Ma. Elenita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Elenita is 46 years old and has one child in school.

Ma. Elenita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Ma. Elenita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 62 years old and single.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Sonia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Sonia has been farming rice for twelve years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Aca

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Aca, who is a 50-year-old married woman with two sons. Aca is a housewife and her husband has been a fisherman for twenty years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Aca will be able to repay the loan received.

Aca and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 45 years old and has four children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Jessica is in the agricultural business, farming coconut in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jessica has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy exercise books and shawls for sale.

loans.name: Hary Lanto

texts.fr:
Hary a 38 ans, elle est mariée. Son mari fait des petits métiers dans une gare routière. Le couple a 3 enfants (21-20-11 ans). L’aîné a également une activité de petit commerce. Les deux autres sont encore étudiants. 
Elle travaillait dans une entreprise franche. Le premier contact avec l’institution de micro finance date de 2012.  Elle a ouvert l’unité de magasin général après la fermeture de l’entreprise. Les prêts antérieurs ont servi à l’extension de l’activité par l’augmentation de fonds de roulement : augmentation et diversification des produits. L’activité est rentable. Le prêt servira à acheter des produits de première nécessité pour l’approvisionnement du magasin : du riz, du sucre, de l’huile, du savon, des bougies et du sel. Le magasin général est la principale source de revenus du ménage. 
La famille vit dans leur propre maison. L’objectif est l’extension de l’unité, le rêve étant de pouvoir éduquer leurs enfants et de vivre dans des conditions beaucoup plus meilleures.
texts.en:
Hary is thirty-eight years old and married to a man who works in a bus depot. The couple have three children (twenty-one, twenty and eleven years old). The eldest already works as a trader and the other two are still studying.

Hary used to work in a FTZ company but, when it closed, she opened a general store. Her first dealings with the field partner, CEFOR, were in 2012. Her previous loans have increased her working capital, expanded the range of products that she sells and helped her create a profitable business. This loan will buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, candles and salt for sale in the shop. This is important as the shop provides most of the income for the family.

Hary lives with her family in their own house. Her aim is to expand her business, be able to educate her children and greatly improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soap, candles, rice, sugar, salt and table oil.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Meet Ruth, a rural smallholder farmer from the Nkubu area of Kenya. Ruth is married to a fellow farmer and has one child. Her family's main income source is milk from their dairy farm. However, they are involved in other agricultural activities such as growing bananas, vegetables, fruits and grains.

The biggest problem that farmers from Nkubu face is the huge deficit in access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmer' yields and incomes are far below what they could be. Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers from Nkubu like Ruth now can buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms.

Ruth is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Lakshmi And Group

texts.en:
Lakshmi is a 39-year-old daily wage labourer. Lakshmi and her family has no access to toilets, and therefore they have to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites. She requires funds to construct a toilet at home, but her meagre monthly savings of INR 1,300 is not sufficient to do so. She thus seeks a loan. With the loan amount, she will purchase labour and materials to construct a toilet in her home.

Lakshmi leads a group of five in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. They come from similar backgrounds, working hard to sustain their families. Taking matters into their own hands, Lakshmi and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of INR 70,000 to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: To construct a toilet and improve sanitation facilities in her home

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 55 years old, married and has six children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and build pigpens.

Susan has been pig fattening for 16 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and to build pigpens.

loans.name: Hazina Group

texts.en:
Stephen is 45 years old, and has been running a roaming and combing machine wood for ten years now. He works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Stephen's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to expand his business. He is so hardworking and happy with the loan. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to expand his business, and covered household expenses.

He will use this loan to improve his business of roaming and combing machine wood. He dreams of finishing construction of his house. He will share this loan with his loan group, Hazina, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to improve his business of roaming and combing machine wood.

loans.name: Jasy Kañy Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jasy Kañy es un grupo nuevo, que se formó gracias a las ganas de superación de las integrantes del grupo. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Selva quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas de vestir, para damas y niños,  también se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, a través de las capacitaciones que hacen, las cuales les permiten poder mejorar sus vidas y la de sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Selva  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de prendas para renovar su stock  ya que las que tiene son de la temporada pasada y quiere poder surtirse para poder ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Jasy Kañy group is a new group which formed thanks to the group members' desire to improve themselves. They are in the poverty elimination program, working hard to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Selva who works selling all sorts of clothing for women and children, her work with the Fundación Paraguay also stands out, through the training that they do, which allows them to be able to improve their lives that those of their loved ones.

Selva asks for this loan to purchase clothing to update her stock because what she has is from last season and she wants to be able to stock up to be able to offer a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to update her assortment of stock.

loans.name: Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROCA FUERTE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Trinidad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de polleras, venta de disfraces, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de cotillones, venta de salchipapas, carnicería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Trinidad es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una promoción de la institución, que se realizó en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carnicería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace tres años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de carne de res por mayor) que adquirirá del matadero municipal y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella aun es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "ROCA FUERTE” communal group will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Collpani. It is made up of nine members and is led by officers of whom Trinidad is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal group carry out are varied and among them are the sale of polleras [traditional Andean skirts], costume sales, neighborhood store, food sales, gift sales, salchipapas [sausages and french fries] sales, and meat sales.

The loan that they will get will benefit the small micro-business owners of whom Trinidad is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a promotion from the institution which was done in her area. Currently, she has a meat selling business, she says that she learned this business at her own initiative three years ago.

The loan that she is getting now is to increase her capital (purchase beef in bulk) which she will bet at the municipal butcher and later will sell at her sales stand. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically since she is still married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase beef in bulk.

loans.name: Suspiro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUSPIRO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elizabeth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas de alpaca, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de abarrotes, venta de cartera para damas, venta de chamarras, venta de carteras de cuero, venta de lencería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elizabeth es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carteras de cuero; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus papás hace más de cinco años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carteras de cuero  por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Suspiro communal group will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal Alto Lima. It is made up of eight members and is led by officers, of whom Elizabeth is the president. The businesses that the members carry out are varied and among them are: alpaca sweater sales, athletic clothing sales, grocery sales, women's handbag sales, jacket sales, leather wallet sales, and lingerie sales.

The loan that they will get will benefit the small micro-business owners of whom Elizabeth is one. She says that a year ago, she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling leather wallets. She says that she learned this business from her parents over five years ago.

The loan that she will get now is to increase her capital (purchase leather wallets in bulk), which she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and will later sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the health center that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase leather wallets in bulk.

loans.name: Roderick

texts.en:
This is Roderick, 21 years old, from the province of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. The majority of Filipinos who live in rural areas experience poverty for lack of financial resources to get an education for better job opportunities. A unique Filipino culture is a closely-knit family, which led Roderick to start a small business to assist his parents in making a living.

Roderick is into a food business. He cooks and sells popular street food in the Phillipines such as "kwek-kwek" (smaller quail eggs) and "tokneneng" (larger chicken eggs). These hard-boiled eggs are dipped in orange coloured flour batter and deep fried then served with sweet sour sauce. Filipinos loved to eat them for snacks. His stations his stall in a populated area.

He hopes trusts out of your good heart you could lend him funds in the amount of Php 40,000 to pay for dozens of quail eggs, chicken eggs, duck eggs, flour, cooking oil to cook "kwek-kwek", "tokneneng", kalamansi, mineral water and soft drinks to sell at his stall. He is thanking God and you in advance for your valued help.

He wishes to sustain and expand his business so he could continue to assist his parents in raising his younger siblings. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients to cook "kwek-kwek", "tokeneneng", plus mineral water and soft drinks to sell as snacks at his stall.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran lives in Lahore. She is 48 and a mother of three sons and two daughters. Her husband is a carpenter by profession. He is hardworking and learned these skills at a very young age. He is now an expert in this business and has workers coming to him to learn these skills. He enjoys teaching others.

He needs to buy plywood, a backsaw, a handsaw, a screwdriver, a claw hammer, an awl, a metal smoothing plan, a brace and bits, etc. - tools for carpenter work, as some of his tools are either worn out or he does not have them. As his income is consumed more in meeting their monthly expenses, he does not have savings to buy these things.

Nazeeran has therefore requested a loan to help her husband buy these tools; she wants to see her husband's business grow and flourish.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her husband's carpenter work.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She earns a living by farming sugar cane and a rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock businesses.

Josephine is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en:
Afshan is a 30-year-old lady and a responsible mother of three sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running his own showroom business for the past 18 years. Afshan's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandise, e.g chairs, wood tables, and other accessories, etc for his business purposes. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise.

To fulfill the needs of her husband, Afshan has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy this merchandise for business purpose.

This will be good for him to earn more income, and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Afshan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy furniture her husband for show room

loans.name: Annalisa

texts.en:
Annalisa is 38 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Annalisa has borrowed and paid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is 48 and the mother of seven children. A big family means more expenses. With her husband being the sole earner in the family, meeting expenses is a major challenge for them.

Rubina's husband has a shoe store where he sells gents, ladies and children's shoes. He is hardworking, honest, and known for fair dealing in his community. He has a variety of shoes at his store but keeps stock according to the season. As winter is approaching, he wants to buy winter stock so that he can continue his business activities.

Since his income is not sufficient, Rubina is here to help her husband by applying for a loan. This loan will be used to buy shoes for the store. They are happy and thankful for BRAC's and Kiva's assistance.

loans.use: To help her husband buy shoes for selling at his store

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 47 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. Erma is in an agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for ten years now and has borrowed six times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to sustain it.

Erma requested a 16,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Erma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
Adolat is a repeat client of IMON. She is a very responsible woman, and she always makes her payments on time.

Adolat was born in 1965 in Tajikistan. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a woodworker. Adolat has her own business. She has been busy feeding cattle. Adolat has been working in this field for more than 12 years. She has great experience in this field.

Adolat is asking for a loan because her son is ill. Her son suffers from a stomach ailment. Doctors must do an operation but Adolat has no money. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni to pay for an operation for her son. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for an operation for her son

loans.name: Crisostomo

texts.en:
Crisostomo, age 55, is a married man with three children. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Crisostomo has a tailoring shop in the Philippines. It is a dressmaking business. He has been in this business for 10 years.

Crisostomo requested a 5,000 Philippine peso loan through Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative to purchase additional materials for his dressmaking business. In the future, Crisostomo would like to save enough money for the expansion of his tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional material for dressmaking.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer de 62 años, divorciada, tiene una hija de 19 años y su negocio es la confección de ropa para niños.
Ella es amable, respetuosa y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max Paredes’ que se caracteriza por agrupar a la mayor parte de la producción manufacturera y el comercio informal. 
Lidia es morena, de baja estatura y físico mediano. Su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hija que estudia y trabaja en el mismo negocio, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de ropa para niños, como; pantalones, buzos deportivos, camisas y otros, “trabajo junto a mi hija que me ayuda todo el tiempo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que toda la producción es familiar, la desventaja es la falta de tela para trabajar. Su sueño es ampliar su puesto de venta, ella desea comprar tela por rollo para confeccionar ropa infantil. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 50 años que lleva en este negocio.
Es por esos motivos que Lidia solicita un préstamo para comprar tela por rollo para confeccionar ropa infantil.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 62 year old woman who is divorced and has a 19 year old daughter and her business is making children's clothing.

She is friendly, respected and very hard working. She manages her business in the "Max Paredes" area known for being a hub of manufacturing production and informal trade.

Lidia is dark-skinned, short and of average build. Her mother tongue is Aymara which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish through general culture and for the business she manages. She shares her life with her daughter who studies and works in the same business. They live in a rented room, built from brick that has potable water, electricity and a sewage system. Her business is making clothing for children such as pants, tracksuits, shirts and other items. "I work with my daughter who helps me all the time..." she says. Her business' advantage is that all of the production is familiar. The disadvantage is the lack of fabric to work with. Her dream is to expand her stall. She wishes to buy rolls of fabric to make children's clothing. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 50 years she has been in business.

It is for these reasons that Lidia is requesting a loan to buy rolls of fabric to make children's clothing.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric to make children's clothing.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 38 and the mother of three children. She lives with her family in a populated area in Lahore. She is a growing entrepreneur and operates a clothes selling business from her house. Friendly and welcoming, she is kind and respectful with her customers. She feels proud to be able to work along with her husband and bring in income for the family. She wants to educate all her children and is determined to do so.

Parveen has requested a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She has observed an increase in interest from the community ladies to buy clothes from her. She has therefore requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to buy more clothes as her income is not sufficient. She aspires to be more successful and open a new outlet in the nearby market in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 44 years old and married with four children. One child is in school. Liza is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 15 years now.

Liza has borrowed 12 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to sustain her business. She has requested a 25,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs. In the future, Liza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.
